description:
A solid neighborhood deli that deservedly sees crowds of people during lunchtime. Pro tip: order ahead of time here on Yelp before you make your way here so that you can skip the line and pick up your order upon arrival.

The Italian combo sandwich on Dutch crunch has been one of my go-tos: a huge heap of meats embedded in some really nice, fresh, delicious bread. When I'm not in the mood for so many calories (or processed meat), the falafel pita sandwich has also been a dependable go-to, although here I order a larger size to compensate for the fact that it's not meaty.

The owner who mans the premises is a super cool guy, and in addition to the sandwiches, you can grab sodas, chips, or other snacks. It's basically your urban neighborhood corner store with a deli that punches far beyond its weight. Thanks Yelpers for an exceptional find!
author: Vincent L.

description:
This spot was recommended to me by my coworkers in San Francisco. They mentioned it was a staple sandwich spot in the city and we had to try. 

It's a really small shop that looks like it hasn't changed in many years, not a bad thing at all. They had many different options for sub sandwiches, a small deli fridge with some salads and a large selection of drinks, chips and candy. 

The staff isn't super friendly or outgoing, but work with a purpose and bang out sandwiches relatively quickly. 

I ordered the Italian combo sandwich that had salami, ham, cotto and cheese on soft sourdough. The ratio of meat to veggies to bread was solid, and overall it was a good sandwich. 

Nothing to knock your socks off, but a really solid sandwich.
author: Jonathan D.

description:
*3.5 Stars

Great bread, no fuss sandwich shop. Get your sando on the hard sourdough roll! The cold cuts, however, are not my favorite. I feel like the meat quality could be brought up a notch. Feel like they have a good thing going though. Consistence joint good for a casual quick bite. 

What I ordered: Italian combo with everything on the hard sourdough roll.
author: Hannah S.

description:
Best sandwich I've had in a really long time!! We got turkey with american and all the toppings that come with it. It's served with mayo on one side and mustard on the other which sounded weird but ended up being delicious! The bread was great too. I got the hard sourdough which was a little tough on my teeth so maybe I'd recommend going with the softer one. 



The person taking our order was very nice and friendly and patient. There's limited outdoor "seating" I.e. a bench and a couple stools. We took ours to go and walked down to the fisherman's Ward to eat there. I'd definitely recommend doing that it was fun!! Again, would HIGHLY recommend.?
author: Lisa H.

description: Delicious sandwiches! Italian New York style deli. The small is big! When it says 6 inches...they mean 6 inches wide!
author: Jen R.

description:
Whenever I'm traveling, I'm a big fan of eating wherever the locals eat.  Yeah, sure, touristy stuff is always fun to do, but when you see a line out the door for an unassuming eatery, you knew I had to ditch whatever lunch plans I'd made, and stop in. 

Freddie's Sandwiches has been around since 1926, and walking into this sandwich shop will time warp you to that era.  Old wood shelving, a simple counter top and deli meat display case, weathered menu and an old school register. Place your order, stand to the side and wait (not long) for the hard working sandwich makers to put together your sandwich.

I went with the turkey pastrami (hot) and was not disappointed.  It was stacked high, tender and juicy, and perhaps the best part was it didn't have the stringy pieces traditional pastrami normally has (oh, and I could swear I was eating regular beef pastrami the whole time).  They also cut the sandwiches in half, and individually wrap the pieces, because these sandwiches are PACKED and you'll have trouble eating the whole thing.

After spending two days in San Francisco, my wallet was starting to yell at me every time I opened it up to spend money (stuff is expensive here).  Not at Freddie's. The price I paid for my enormous sandwich and soda (around $12) wasn't bad at all.
author: Rafael A.

description: One of the best subs I've had in SF!!! I also love marina submarine, but it's cash only and the line takes forever- this was so easy, half the price and almost even better! Ordered 1 sandwich on Eat24, was at my door in 30 min and the order was spot on. Got the club sandwich on soft sour dough bread and the bread was truly soft (other places say soft, but I find myself trying to rip through it) and there was plenty of meat. Excited I have a new go to and can get just 1 sub straight to my door now!
author: CJ T.

description:
I stopped by here to grab a sandwich after a tour of Alcatraz Island. They were in the process on cleaning all of the deli equipment in preparation to close, but still were able to put one together for me.

I ordered a roast beef sandwich on sourdough bread. The sandwich was incredible-- there was plenty of roast beef, the sourdough was fresh and light, and the rest of the sandwich was delicious. Very happy that I chose to go here over nearby Boudin.
author: Ben C.

description:
Small and local sandwich shop. My favorite.
Quick, cheap, tasty. There is a lot of variety of menu.
I got Italian combo small size with onion roll. $7.
Even small size, it was more than I can finish for lunch. I went there Friday noon but there was only 2 customers before me. They made my sandwich right after I ordered there and took only a few minutes.
I want to try crab sandwich next time.
author: Nazuki Y.

description: Best f*cking bologna sandwich ever and I don't even like bologna!!! I was recommended this place by a former manager and have ordered from them a few times now! Get that sandwich!
author: Desiree B.

description:
Solid deli perched on a hill in North Beach, and close enough to my workplace for a nice midday walk. This beats having to go down to Trader Joe's for lunch, and it definitely beats overpaying for a sandwich down in the Financial District. I spent less than $10 here and walked away stuffed, so this is definitely a good lunch choice.

I went for a small Italian sub with small side of potato salad. The Italian sub was delicious and the meat bountiful. Their salame and salame cotto are special standouts, while ham is a reliable, salty addition. All the fixings here includes pickles, onions, lettuce, tomato, mayo, and mustard. Some add-ons are free, such as their garlic spread, which is a little similar to the one at Little Lucca down south. If you're coming with another person, you could theoretically buy two sandwiches and swap, as they come wrapped as two halves.  For $6.95, this is a San Francisco steal.

The potato salad was sadly not what I expected. This tasted like a mishmash of egg salad and potato salad, and I don't really like egg salad. However, the portion was quite good for $2 more. 

The other sides, like pasta salad and potato chips, are also relatively affordable. There are also many drink options if you're craving something sweet. From Mexican Coke to guava Fanta, there's bound to be something from your childhood that you desperately want to have. And if anyone gets a chance to try what looks like homemade baklava on their counters, let me know how it goes, 'cause I'm craving.
author: Gwen W.

description: In a tiny little hole in the wall store but these sandwiches are so good!  I'm so glad we decided to walk two blocks from the Pier 39 tourist trap!!!we both had the hot pastrami sandwich. Yummmmmmmm
author: Nicole G.

description:
Straightforward and unpretentious sandwich shop that gets you in and out with minimal fuss. Freddie's Sandwiches has been serving lunch sammies to hungry customers since 1926. That's almost a century now! 

Choose from 20+ sandwich options and numerous  kinds of bread (e.g. sourdough hard vs. semi-hard vs. soft roll). Anything from Jewish classics like hot pastrami to everyday staples like chicken salad. My personal favorites here are the Hot Copa and the Italian Combo. The latter consists of a mix of hams, salamis, and cheese. Yes they are pretty meat-heavy options but oh so satisfying. I've found the small 6" sandwich more than enough for me but you can go larger (8") or "I hope you're sharing" huge (half or whole loaf).

Lines can be long during prime lunchtime but they're pretty efficient and try to get you in and out as quickly as possible. It's satisfying sandwiches, quick service, and the fact that they accepts cards that make Freddie's a lunchtime staple in the neighborhood.
author: Jon L.

description: Delicious, fresh subs with a variety of bread options including Dutch crunch and soft sourdough. A small is around $7 and is certainly not small. It comes sliced in half and a small could feed 2 people. A great to-go option!
author: Leeyen R.

description: BEST deli sandwich I've had in the city! Better then molanaris! I know! Never thought I'd say it! They're peppered turkey and Dutch crunch is unbelievable! Hidden little gem! And been around since 1926!!! LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!!!
author: Sara M.

description: First time I came in 2016 i had and loved the Italian combo I ordered! This time I decided to try the club and also try Dutch crunch bread and it was seriously the best decision I've made!!!!!! I've never had Dutch crunch before but I think it might be my new favorite. I typically always get wheat or white bread so if you like those kinds seriously give Dutch crunch a try here. Your welcome ;p
author: Jaz M.

description: As many already stated, their sandwiches are great. It's a little pricey, but the quality is worth splurging on. You can also call ahead & place an order, but even as a walk- in customer, the longest I had to wait was maybe 10-15 minutes.
author: Lucy G. K.

description:
My favorite place to get sandwiches every single day. The owner is super friendly

My go to sandwich is the smoked turkey, dutch crunch bread, pepperjack cheese, with everything, toasted. Definitely try either the jalapeño/pepperocini/garlic spread. Pepperocini is my favorite.

If you're in the mood for a fatty meal, definitely get the hot pastrami
author: Dylan M.

description:
I love this small and local sandwich shop! Everything from the food, the unpretentious look and feel of the shop, the plastic benches outside, the friendly owner and staff; this place is what I imagine in my dreams when I think about a great local business. It just has that local family-owned business vibe that I personally love.

What I liked:
* Great tasting sandwiches with generous amounts of meat and fresh ingredients
* Interesting shop with a ton of drinks/sodas lining the shelves
* Small local restaurant vibe with plastic benches outside (if you're high brow, this might be a con for you, but it added to the vibe for me)

What I disliked:
* The wait is fairly long since this place is popular and many people order on the phone and pick up. This isn't a place I would go to if I was in a hurry.
author: Michael M.

description:
I can't really write much about this spot since It was catered for a meeting I was just at. I really enjoyed the potato salad, well I love potato salad so it isn't really hard to impress me. 

The sandwich... well that was just ok. It's hard to impress me there when I have been so privileged with Roxie's (my childhood sandwich hot spot in the city).

But I'm thankful either way. :) If I am ever near, I'd try their tuna. Looked appetizing!
author: Jray M.

description: Dutch crunch! The Italian was amazing. As was my tuna salad on whole wheat.  No real sit down spot except benches outside, but it was a beautiful day.
author: Kristen O.

description: I got a turkey sandwich and while it was delicious, I did not think it was worth the price. I would highly recommend ordering online first because the line gets quite long especially around lunch time. It is one of the few good places in this area though
author: Rachel N.

description:
Fine sandwiches made with care and good ingredients.  Nice bread.

My only complaint is that their accompanying salads (pasta, potato & egg, coleslaw) are always a little disappointing.
author: William K.

description: Delicious! that's what my husband said. We actually stumbled onto Freddie's by chance. We were walking down Stockton toward the wharf.  I saw the sign, since 1926,  has to be good. Ordered the Club Sandwich on semi hard sourdough, the best bread ever. They even had it lightly toasted. The sandwich was excellent. Took a little time to make the sandwich, lots of selection of drinks. Will visit if we ever in SF again.
author: Jenny S.

description:
Pros: Gotten the Italian combo once but not for me. Extremely generous with the meat. I normally get the veggie sandwich every time I'm here. Super fresh and lots of flavor.
 
Cons: Typical long wait during lunch rush hours make this small local shop kinda cramped. Try coming at least 15 mins before noon or placing your order online. 
 
Ordered: Small Veggie Sandwich ($7) 
 
Would I recommend: Yes!
author: Terry N.

description: Best sandwiches In San Francisco I had ever tried. Nice little mom and pop store, easy grab n go. Affordable and good quality foods to make their delicious sandwiches. A must stop location when your around the Fishermans wharf.
author: Kristopher G.

description: My go-to Sandwich spot which is saying a lot because NB has a TON of sandwich options. Their soft sourdough bread is sooo good on my Italian sando.
author: Garrett S.

description:
These sandwiches f*** sh** up!!!%#&^! Apologies for getting all vulgar, but saying "these sandwiches were really good!" would not suffice to the level of GOODNESS SERVED IN THESE SANDWICHES!!!¡¡!! 

Got a hot pastrami to-go, not knowing I had a hell of a sandwich on hand. As I was on the sidewalk walking towards the pier, we unraveled the sandwich and when I took a bite, I had to stop. I had to stop walking to take in what had just happened to me. I was in disbelief that I could ever have the thought that I may like these sandwiches more than Ike's love and sandwiches. 

I went as far as to go on Zillow to look at how much housing around this sandwich place was, even though I already knew I could never afford it HA. Anyway, if you happen to have 4 million $$ laying around, I'd recommend living right next to this sandwich shop because it's so good you could probably eat it 3 meals a day ;)

Hope to eat you again soon Freddie's!!
author: Annie N.

description: Great local place to grab quick lunch! Tasted great and had tons of options, people were very friendly as well. I would recommend and definitely go back.
author: Isabelle O.

description: Favorite sandwich spot, ever. The soft sourdough is the best bread I've ever had. The small size is way more than enough for less than 8 dollars.
author: Pj M.

description:
I really cant add anymore than Adam S has said but this is a legit sandwich shop. 

Had a chicken salad on dutch crunch...and everything was good. The bread is very fresh. The chicken salad was amazing. 

Also had a side of potato salad and it was good as well.

Atmosphere is nonexistent but that's not why you're here!

Prices are fair
author: David G.

description: Been looking for a place like this! A delicious sandwich shop that is a hidden gem. Has a great local feel to it, everyone was so courteous and friendly. Got the hot pastrami and it was SO GOOD! I'll definitely be back and will recommend to everyone who's hungry!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
I went here a month ago and was told the workers were tired that the excuse was given I believe from the owner I paid for cheese and I wanted chicken in my sandwich but it was flat with no meat 

I took it back and did a review on this sandwich shop and said actually what had happened & 

THIS IS THE RESPONSE I GOT FROM FREDDIES SANDWICH SHOP TODAY 10/9/2017 AT 7:45am

Who the hell are you to bitch about some cheese! Get a life and quit your complaining! We definitely remember you and please don't ever come back!
author: Jay S.

description:
I was quite intrigued by such a high Yelp score near such a touristy area.  It's a bit into a residential neighborhood, so it's definitely not touristy and seemed quite popular with locals.  Apparently it's been around since 1926; though the aesthetic is very 60s/70s.  The sandwiches are packed with a ton of meat and are reasonably priced (for San Francisco).

Italian Combo on Dutch Crunch (Whole Loaf): Apparently one of the more popular items, so had to try it.  It had four types of meat (ham, dry salami, pressed ham, salami cotto) and provolone cheese, all in generous portions.  I ordered the 25-inch whole loaf, since I was feeling gluttonous.  I had it cut into 4 sections and just 1/4 was enough to fill me up for lunch.  Yay, leftovers!  Technically speaking, it seemed like two small footlong loaves since my sandwich had four end pieces.  No fancy ingredients, very no frills, but still delicious.
author: Adam B.

description: Such a nice place. Staff were very nice to our three kids. A nice break from the touristy area yet close enough for tourist to walk to. Delicious sandwiches.
author: Amy B.

description: Pretty mediocre sandwich place. Clean small and efficient. I got the pastrami sandwich as recommended but was not a huge fan. Tried it with their spread with all the fixings except mayo. The meat itself was really salty but there was plenty of it.  The soft sourdough bread was killer though! I ordered it through Yelp because I work nearby and this was one of the higher rated places. Theres definitely better sandwiches out there so I wouldn't go out of your way.
author: Navdeep D.

description:
Tour guides will probably take you to Molinari, so here's how you get the best sandwich there:
Head northwest on Columbus towards Vallejo
Turn right on Stockton
Turn left on Francisco.
Walk into Freddies and order an Italian Combo on dutch with hot pepper. 
Best sandwiches in the city by far.
author: Scot V.

description:
Sandwiches the way sandwiches should be!

Freddie's is one of those places that you might walk by time after time and not get curious enough to walk into, but once you do you'd hooked for good! 

This little place offers a wide variety of sandwiches made with fresh ingredients that are combined in variety of delicious ways! If you are visiting North Beach and want to grab something on the go, Freddie's is the place for you! If you live in or around the neighborhood and want to grab a sandwich before you go on a hike or seat in a park and have picnic or just have an awesome sandwich, guess what? Freddie's is the place for you! 

My favorites are Italian Combo and Mortadella Sandwiches, but everything else I have tried has been good. No one can beat Freddie's when it comes to quality and price! Don't believe me? Find out for yourselves! :-)
author: Afshin A.

description:
Good sandwich! Waited a full half hour for it.

Line size is deceiving... they take orders by phone (& online?), so while line not so big they have huge orders of 5-10 sandos at a time queued up ahead of you, people coming in and out to grab. It'd be nice if they said something. If line were around the block I would not have come in.

Takeaway: Sandwich good but not that good. Call ahead, or otherwise go somewhere else.
author: Jeff B.

description: My favorite sandwich deli spot, so glad it's in my hood!  Nice owner and staff, delicious fresh salads, many drink options and love the cookies and baklava. Stay awesome Freddie's...
author: Lola M.

description:
Amazing deli sandwiches. I'm a sucker for a solid cold sand which and this place does the trick! 

Turkey pastrami on semi hard sourdough, top notch stuff!
author: Alex H.

description: Been coming here for years, one of the best sandwich spots in the city! They have a line so call ahead to get your order.  They are so nice and the sandwiches are fantastic!
author: Sheila N.

description: We come here for their reviews. We were expecting excellent sandwiches. The sandwich were average, not bad but no reason to go back. There is no seating, although the owner was kind to get us some chairs, but if you are expecting a side down place, this is not it. Sandwiches are good size.
author: Adelaide B.

description: Great service, I had the popular italian combo it was the best sandwich. I would make this a must to try while in San Francisco.
author: Sherrie S.

description:
Favorite sandwich place. Ever. 

Stellar service. Beautiful bread. Delicious dinner, lunch, or breakfast. 
I usually get the Italian combo. The small easily is enough but the loaf ensures that I can enjoy Freddie's for more than just one meal. Soft white bread is a MUST. The sandwich contents are perfect for the bread-to-filling ratio. Salami, provolone, ham, and everything else promises a variety of flavor in a single sandwich. 

Parking is tough nearby, but can always find street parking up or down the block and the short walk is well worth it.
author: Sarah L.

description: The best Sandwich Spot hands down. My personal favorite, hot Coppa on Dutch crunch everything on it and the spicy spread. I'm addicted to it! I've been coming here for almost a week now. It's really hard to find a spot with good deli sandwiches but I am so lucky to find one so close to my job. I guess that says a lot since this place has been here since the 1920s.
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
90 years is a great run.  Think about it, when this place got started, Calvin Coolidge was the President.  Silent Cal.  I kid you not.  The Depression was years away, Franklin Roosevelt wasn't even the Governor of New York yet.  It was Prohibition.  Several of my grandparents weren't even born.  There was no such thing as Mickey Mouse.  No Golden Gate or Bay Bridges.  30 years away from the Giants and Dodgers coming to California.  Don't even think about TV, Computers, or Cell Phones.  Or, Smart Phones.  We are talking seriously back in the day.  Old School.  And, my friends, there is a reason Freddie's remains:  

Freddie's makes a damn good sandwich.  It is not the most novel sandwich.  It is not a foodie adventure.  There are many fine sandwiches around but I'll tell you that this is my Desert Island place if I could only have one place because they do things right.  

I was first exposed to Freddie's several years ago on Nob Hill.  Freddie's #2 was located on Pine Street, between Polk and Larkin.  They had the exact same menu.  The first several times I passed by I thought little of it.  Then I tried the Italian Combo.  I don't remember how I struck up the conversation exactly, but the proprietor recommended the Pepperoncini Spread on the sandwich.  From there, it was on like Donkey Kong.    At any rate, Freddie's #2 became Ti Ti Cafe (same menu, new owners, who I believe were former employees).  That lasted only so long.  Now the location is occupied by Cookie Love.  I am very sad that it is gone.  It had been a while.  Finally, I decided to venture over to the OG Freddie's in North Beach which dates way back.  

This is a stout sandwich.  They slice the meat to order and put a lot of meat on your sandwich.  The fixings seem to work just right.  The bread is delicious.  I'd love to tell you what makes this place special, but I feel very confident in telling you that they just have the mojo, vibe or quintessence that is intangible.  The echoes of a 90 year-old shop live on.  It's no frills, you have to go out of your way, and they aren't open late.  I have literally gone out of my way to grab a sandwich to take home for dinner.  So good.  

Here are some things to note:

1.  The Italian Combo.  This is the signature sub.  They would recommend it on Soft Sourdough.  It's Salame, Ham, Cotto, Pressed Ham and Cheese.  I always go with regular fixings, no mustard or pickles, add oil and vinegar and the vaunted Pepperoncini Spread.  Oddly, this is the cheapest sandwich.
2.  The Bread.  All of the bread is delicious.  They have multiple versions of Sourdough, as well as Wheat, and Dutch Crunch.  BTW - If you are not a SF-ista, you may not know what Dutch Crunch is.  Check out the Wikipedia article.  It's great bread.  The bread at Freddie's is an attraction unto itself.  I will say that the Semi-Hard Sourdough is a bit chewy, but it is SO tasty.
3.  They slice it fresh to order.  They have a full selection of great deli meats.  They can make them hot or cold.  I have a hard time going with anything other than the Italian Combo, but there are so many others.  The sandwiches are meat driven.  No cutesy sandwiches.  
4.  Spreads.  The have Pepperoncini (mild), Jalepeno (hot) and a terrific Garlic Spread.  Delicious.
5.  The Size.  They have Small 6", Large 8", Half Loaf 12" and Whole Loaf "24 Inch.  A Half Loaf is a heck of a Sandwich.    
6.  Old School Factor.  You can't emphasize this enough.  This is one of those great old school places that simply are not going to be duplicated.  You think a winning formula can never die.  What I'm about to say is sad but true:  It will.  Great old school places always cease to be what they used to be.  I urge you not to miss out on this one.  

Truly, this is one of my favorite places in San Francisco.  I wish that #2 was still a block away, but that ship sailed.  If you haven't been to Freddie's, go soon.  It is a terrific spot and one I will go to at least every other week for as long as I remain in SF.
author: Adam S.

description:
Freddie's is a neighborhood gem. Just out of the bustle between the wharf and the pier it sits north of Russian Hill on Stockton. This is an old school joint. Don't expect the fanciest decor, but when you and the gang need a reasonably priced well portioned lunch sando Freddie and the gang will hook you up.

There are lots of bread options like Dutch crunch, sourdough, French breads, whole wheat and more. Tons of choices from a healthy veggie or egg salad to the decadent pastrami or mortadella. Pro tip - hot pepper spread is good on everything.

Freddy is incredible. He makes supporting this long time local shop a no brainer. It doesn't hurt that you can pre-order takeout on the yelp app
author: Adam T.

description:
My first time going to Freddie's was about 10 minutes ago. The vibe is super legit and old school. I ordered the Italian combo on sweet dutch w/ 'chini and garlic spread and now have a massive flavor erection that will probably last more than six hours and demand I consult a physician ASAP. 

Will be going back to try the pastrami, egg salad, buffalo chicken and everything else.

Also pepsi in a glass bottle and tater salad that's off the chain. 

Regards, 

Mitch
author: Mitch G.

description: When Thursday evening's "one drink" turned into five drinks and you're feeling a bit worst for ware, Freddie's is the ultimate Friday hangover sandwich. OG deli style, piled high with meat, with house pickles, mustard and shredded lettuce. I never wanted it to end.
author: Hugh W.

description: I truly believe this is one of the best Sandwich Shops in San Francisco. There so good and the people are warm and friendly. They make your sandwich quick (but not poorly built). There is also outdoor seating. Definitely give this place a try! You WONT be disappointed! (All of this is written as I eat my sandwich) : )
author: Jessica A.

description: Amazing sandwich!  Stumbled upon the shop and was glad we went in.  Shared a large turkey on sourdough and we both had plenty!  Best deal in town so far...
author: Deb R.

description: I will try this place again when they aren't crowded so I can have my sandwich made the way I like it.  I must say they were very organized and moved smoothly through the crowd out the door!  Very nice owner and staff!
author: Kathy W.

description: Such a solid spot! Being able to purchase through yelp ahead is awesome because I order then stop there on my way to the airport. Then I have a sandwich that will hold me over through a whole day of flying!
author: Alexa R.

description: The Italian combo was delicious. The service was fast and everybody was nice. Can't wait to go back and try the other sandwiches.
author: Lauren D.

description:
I kept hearing how great this was but sadly as a foodie, the bread was way too hard and the Italian sub keep coming out because I had to bite so hard, and I ordered semi soft...

I have had better in Oakland. But it was not bad at all. Better than average. :)
author: Carenna W.

description:
i want to like this place as much as everyone else, but they never make my sandwich right. 
i dont like mayo and mustard on my sandwich. so i always ask for oil and vinegar and never seem to get it. i even ask for extra oil and vinegar or lots of oil and vinegar and everytime get a dry sandwich with no oil and vinegar.  i go there cause its 2 blocks from my job, and everytime end up wondering why i return
author: Oiland V.

description:
Solid, hole in the wall place for sandwiches. I got the turkey pastrami sandwich on semi-hard sourdough bread. The bread was delightful. The innards were a perfect ration of lettuce, mustard, cheese, and pastrami. I was also really hungry so that helped a lot. My company's vegetarian sandwich also looked so fresh and delicious, and he confirmed. 

Definitely recommend this place for a low key, easy, on-budget meal - only if you want something delicious.
author: Pam H.

description:
Delicious subs made in a tiny diner with outside seating only. An almost movie like Italian family prepares the food and if you're lucky you can catch a seat in the shade on a bench on the East side of the building. 

Fun neighborhood to people watch in as well. Everyone from school kids to millionaires in classic cars out and about on a sunny day.
author: Sam C.

description: I'm just bummed that I've worked around the corner from this place for a year and a half before I discovered it. It's popular, so ordering online ahead of time if possible will save you precious lunch break time. I can't say enough good things about the variety in this place! Seriously, you have never seen such a broad offering of sodas and chips to pair with your sandwich. If you feel like biting into a delicious chewy fluff cloud, go for the "soft sourdough"; doesn't disappoint! My go-to is the Italian combo, but everything looks fantastic. There's minimal seating outside and none inside, so be prepared to eat on the sidewalk. Great neighborhood for it though!
author: Emily B.

description:
You've gotta love hole-in-the-walls. There's something great about family-owned eateries with a lot of heart and local flair. Freddie's is one of those.

In what looks from the outside like a small convenience store are perhaps the best sandwiches in North Beach. That being said, though, they're still not worth going out of your way for.

The best part of Freddie's is the incredible number of fresh breads they offer. Want dutch crunch? You got it. Like onion rolls? Bingo? How about sourdough? They've got three varieties for you. You can get your sandwich your way and enjoy it on some great, hearty bread.

The condiments for the sandwiches are also solid. The cheeses aren't soggy, the veggies are fresh, and the spreads are pungent and flavorful. If you don't like heat, I would still recommend you go with the pepperoncini spread. For the spice fiends: jalapeno spread. It's worth adding on to your sandwich (at no additional cost).

Unfortunately, I find the meats a bit lacking in Freddie's Sandwiches. They're just somewhat standard deli offerings. Sure, there may be some fancier-sounding Italian offerings, but they're still not excellent. A good Italian combo has high-quality meats, often cured in-house. Mine here mostly just tasted like over-hydrated ham. Perhaps the pastrami would be a better option.

There are better places to dine in North Beach/Telegraph Hill, but if you're particularly feeling like a sandwich, this is a good place to go.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
We could tell this place was going to be authentic as soon as we saw the giant sandwich on the window outside. 

Step inside and initially it's confusing. A wall FULL of candy and snacks. Giant cloves of garlic hanging from many points on the ceiling-- I didn't know vampires were so rampant in North Beach. And then a deli counter right in front of you.

I got the veggie and add black forest ham-- VERY satisfying. The small sandwich is definitely big enough. There were 5+ breads to choose from, and I can't remember the total $$, but it was definitely reasonable. 

A very local corner spot- so the line wasn't too long. There are no seats, though, (except for a bench outside) so you gotta get it to go.

Can't wait to go back to this magical shop.
author: Steph D.

description: Used to work nearby. Great sandwiches, I still go out of my way to pick up lunch here from time to time.
author: Andrew B.

description: I can settle for this shop sandwich! I love eating outside and enjoying the San Francisco sunny weather
author: Zki R.

description: Really really good sandwiches....big and cheap. Nothing over the top or extraordinary, just another gem of an SF neighborhood sandwich shop.
author: James A.

description: The wait was almost an hour for 2 cold sandwiches, defitnetly should call in to place your order. The sandwiches were better a few years ago, but still overall I give the food a B-
author: G G.

description: This is an amazing sandwich shop.  No frills, no big name chain just your little ma and pa corner sandwich shop with great sandwiches.  The Italian combo on semi hard sour dough was delicious.  They pack it full of meat and use my favorite shredded lettuce.  It is a very hearty sandwich.  A small made for a very filling lunch.  No dining in but they did have benches and small folding tables outside.  It was a great stop on our self guided tour of San Francisco.
author: Alan L.

description: Simply put. Best bargain in San Fran. Awesome handmade sandwich with lots of whatever you ask for. Price makes this a delicious and filling bargain. Here is the hint.. the small sandwich is actually big.  Hidden Gem just a couple of blocks off the Embarcadero.
author: Jay J.

description: Every time I am near Freddie's I stop in, in fact I'm going there for lunch today! They make the best deli sandwiches I have had in the Bay Area.  The place always has a line trust me when I say there is a reason for it. If your in the area I highly recommend this deli for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. As stated before they always have a line so I highly suggest calling in a phone order for pick up. Happy eating!
author: Scott Z.

description: Great sandwich from an authentic old school shop. Had the Italian Combo, it was great.
author: Richard R.

description: It's not like this place is a secret, but be prepared for a line and a wait. Advice to the newbie, order on the left, wait on the right. Freddie's make excellent and honest sandwiches the way you want them. Not all the foofooey stuff that SF is known for, just good sandwiches, made by hand to order. When your job takes you to the Fisherman's Wharf area, and the last thing you want is tourist fare, having this place 4 blocks from work is a little bit of daily happiness. The egg salad is creamy deliciousness. Get it and enjoy. Small bits I learned; if you want to avoid the lines, go before 12 or after 2, and get the small sandwich unless you're famished, the large is like 2 sandwiches in one. Please, please, keep the old school charm.
author: Roger G.

description: If you want fresh and good sandwiches. You should come here. It was my first time and liked it.
author: Jasmine B.

description:
What can you say about Freddie's that hasn't already been said?  That Freddie's is 11 years shy of the century mark?  That Freddie's is 11 years older than the Golden Gate Bridge?

I just wish I had a Freddie's in the east bay.  I ordered the italian combo (dry salame, ham, salame cotto, pressed ham, and cheese).  I ordered a large, but probably should have ordered the regular.  It was huge!  I'm dating myself, but we use to call that the Dagwood (Bumstead) sandwich.  Best sandwich I have had in a while.  Also ordered the pasta salad.  Artichoke hearts, olives, great seasoning along with the pasta, goes great with the sandwich.  

I'm glad I walked there to/from the Embacadero.  After that sandwich and pasta, I needed to walk off some calories (but it was worth it!).
author: Bevin H.

description: We were exploring San Francisco and just wanted a sandwich And let me tell you about this little hole in the wall. The sandwiches are amazing here and so fresh. I seen so many kids from local schools coming in to get food and the owners knew most of them. Thought that was a cool touch. Support your local businesses.
author: Rick G.

description:
Love this place! Quick, delicious subs with fresh ingredients. The man at the cashier has been there over 20 years and he is just a great, friendly guy! 

They have great hours, open until 4! And what I love the most is that the ladies making the sandwiches use gloves! It makes me feel it's much cleaner than nearly everywhere else in the city. The gloves!!! Yes! Clean food!! And for a great price!
author: Lynne M.

description:
Biggest complaint is that they are slow. No matter if you show up to order or place a pickup order on Eat24, they always seems to take 20-25 minutes to make your sandwiches. 

It's a complete hole in the wall and recently they've added a few chairs and tables outside.

But no matter, we don't come here for the nice decor, we come for the delicious italian combo w/ dutch crunch bread! 

Probably the best sandwich in North Beach, besides perhaps Molinari's
author: Mingmei N.

description: Had a pastrami sandwich and I LOVED IT!! Their meat is VERY GOOD! .... also they have benches, chairs and little movable tables outside! Perfect for a sunny day in SF
author: Lloyd N.

description: Oh my god this was so good. Everything was so fresh  and the service was quick and kind.
author: Haydn C.

description:
Great old school Italian deli tucked away in north beach. According to the window, Freddie's has been around for almost a century (since 1926!) and they're definitely doing something right! Mostly focused on Italian style deli sandwiches. You can choose your bread, meats, and toppings and they make it to order. 

The sandwiches are huge - I got a "small" hot coppa with everything on it and added pepperoccini spread and my boyfriend got a large  Italian Combo and he couldn't finish his. 

We took ours to go, walked down to the wharf and hopped on a ferry to angel island, hiked to the top of Mt Livermore and ate our sandwiches while enjoying views of the Bay. We got our sandwiches on hard sourdough rolls which was perfect for packing along for our hike bc the bread didn't get soggy. It was a great treat to have yummy sandwiches after the uphill hike. Although, I will say that our packs were significantly lighter after polishing off those sandwiches!
author: Alison H.

description: Freddie's is awesome. One of the best bang for your bucks you can find for a sandwich in the city especially with the Italian Combo. Service is great and I always enjoy Ed. Does a great job of remembering you as he has regulars. The size of the food is plentiful, definitely no need to order a large sandwich. Nothing I would change about this place. One piece of advise is during peak hours the wait can be long---call ahead, fax your order or use one of the apps they are partnered with to place your order ahead of time.
author: Matthew B.

description:
Freddie's is the best. I live a half block up Stockton and go here whenever I can. I'm usually at work during their hours but go every single time i work from home. 

Eddie, who works the register, is always happy to greet you and always gets my very picky order right. 

Great ingredients, very friendly staff, I feel so lucky that it's 25 steps from my front door. Love it so much!!!
author: Mackenzie H.

description: I remembered their salami sandwiches during lunch time when I was going to school across the street here decades ago! Still around and strong, and the salami and mustard on soft french roll still taste exactly the same. One bite and the memories came rushing back.
author: Peter T.

description: Unassuming, no-frills Italian deli in North Beach.  The Italian Combo was solid, and a great value given the size of the sandwich.  I ordered mine on sweet Dutch crunch with pepperoncini spread based on a tip, and the pepperoncini spread especially was a great (mildly spicy) addition.
author: Alex S.

description: Didn't want to go to a tourist spot for mediocre sandwich. This is not far walking from Fishermans Wharf. Old time mom and pop sandwich shop. Got the small Italian combo on sour dough. It's huge! Comes wrapped in two separate halves. Got the jalapeño spread on it as well-so good.
author: Laura R.

description: Love this place. The vibe is great, the choices are beyond expansive, and the sandwiches always bring it home.
author: Brittany A.

description:
I basically come to Freddie's every week since I work just down the street. I come here because the sandwhiches are excellent, the service is fast, and the prices are resonable. Customers can order easily in person, via telephone, or online (yelp or eat24). 

Some Advice:

Either call in or order online because there is always a long line out the door. Try to come not during the lunch hour because this is when they are at their absolute busiest. Also, their Chicken Salad is super fresh!
author: Jeannel M.

description:
I was so glad to find this place! It is exactly what I wanted on a day of sight seeing and doing touristy things because it was a little hole in the wall place away from all the tourism- there were just a few other people there besides us. 
I got the Italian combo on the crusty sourdough. It was delicious, however next time I will get the soft sourdough because the crunchy one was so hard to bite and when I would bite down all the meat squished out the back. Something I found to work was keeping it wrapped up in the paper and eating it like a burrito. That kept it a little more together. Other than that- very delicious! Oh and the small is very filling!
author: Emma M.

description: I loved the sandwiches at this place. It's a small little shop but the size does nothing to stand for how yummy the sandwiches were. It was easy to find and walk to on our way back from The Alcatraz cruises pier. The wait was not too long for our sandwiches and they even have a little bit of seating outside if you want to eat your sandwiches right there!!
author: Desere S.

description:
A day in the City with Tram N brought us here for Lunch. The place is pretty small and had Tram not done her research about this place I wouldn't have known they sold Sandwiches as it's a small convenience store with the counter at the back.

I ordered a Turkey on Wheat (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/freddies-sandwiches-san-francisco?select=CaEt7bYei_oQk8XxaTwXiA#C3mRH2HipjqmBpH8ampadQ) for $6.45 which was ready fairly quickly. Although because of the ordering system some other woman took my Sandwich (booo!) They don't take names, instead just call out the order so the lady grabbed mine despite ordering after me and having a completely different style bread. It took about 5 minutes and me questioning what was going on for the guy serving to figure it out.

That aside the Sandwich was pretty good. Everything was fresh, they put in a lot of Turkey and the bread nice and soft. It was also cut in half and wrapped separately which I really liked as I often only eat half and save the rest for later so it made things a little easier for me. The only disappointment was that I asked for it to be toasted and it wasn't.

The Sandwiches are in varying sizes from 6 inch all the way to 25 inches which are a very reasonable $24 and they also have a few baked goods (Muffins, Cookies and Baklava). They don't have tables to eat your food at but they do have a few plastic chairs stacked outside that you can sit at if you mind eating off of your lap.

*NOTE* Had I got my Sandwich toasted like I asked and an apology for giving my order to someone else this would have been closer to a 4 star review.
author: Emmalouise B.

description: Great sandwiches, reasonable prices. Some of the best sandwiches in the city! Very low-key atmosphere, not a lot of seating, but plenty of great scenic places nearby to sit and eat your lunch.
author: Nicole H.

description:
This place is definitely a hidden Gem for the North Beach neighborhood.
I've been coming here since my middle school days (back in 2003). What I can tell you is hands down, the best sandwiches in SF Bay Area! Their sandwiches are huge, even half of one will get you full. They sell in half sizes or large aka whole sandwich. Ingredients are always fresh and they have wide selections of bread, meat, and cheese. Salami on Soft (Soft sourdough roll) or Dutch crunch is my favorite. They also sell snacks, drinks, muffins, macaroni salads, and more! Accepts credit card and street parking is super easy. I believe they still offer student discount for the Francisco students. The owner has is super nice & friendly. You can tell they put in thought when making your sandwich. Not rushed or sloppy. Also they toast your bread for free and offer free spreads which is great!
author: Diana T.

description: This place is absolutely AMAZING!! Workers are so nice and food comes very quick. Never had a BLT as amazing as this one. I could eat here everyday 10/10
author: Jourdan F.

description: Great Sandwich! It was huge and tasty. They took a bit long to make it however it was a weekday during lunchtime. I highly recommend it when visiting SF.
author: Maria I.

description: Great deli sandwiches. Super friendly service. Easy bike parking. Enjoy your lunch on the outdoor benches.
author: Vicki L.

description: I had my childhood here in the neighborhood.   While I was attending Francisco middle school I remember buying salami and cheese on french roll sandwich.   I remember Freddie and his wife at this shop.   They both were pretty old already, wonderful human being.   Their sandwich are much better now, but I miss Freddie and his wife making their sandwich for me.
author: Tony W.

description:
Wow. Truly great sandwich shops are too few and far between and Freddie's is one of the greats! I'm so happy I found this place (sad that I found it on my last day in SF or all of my meals would have been here).  It's a hole in the wall place that I would not have found or even thought of trying had it not been for Yelp.

The large sandwiches are huge. Enough for two people or two meals. My husband got a Ham/ Roast Beef on Sourdough Soft. He was raving about it (and he is the pickiest guy around). I got the Italian Combo, on Dutch with jalapeño spread. Delicious!

It was a little over $20 for two large subs and two bags of chips. A steal for the size of these subs really.

This place is a must if you're in town near the Wharf!
author: Michelle F.

description: This place is one of the better local sandwich shops in the area. Nice staff with a great selection of options to choose from.
author: Joseph B.

description: Awesome sandwiches, happy help.  People who know their sandwiching craft!  Perfectly off the tourist trap area of Fisherman's wharf and just a few blocks away.
author: B K.

description: We stopped here before taking the ferry to Angel Island. Vegetarian sandwich okay--cheese and avocado made it substantial. They also have falafel and egg salad, but besides this it's your typical sandwich place:  do you want meat or extra meat on that? Servings are enormous--one sandwich would have been enough for the two of us. Bread is amazing. I also get pretty happy when the soda selection is this good--old school brands like A&W Cream Soda, Squirt, Ginger Ale in both regular and diet. Overall, glad we stopped here--eating options out on the piers are not this good.
author: E. R.

description: Authentic spectacular sandwich shop. Hole in the wall, serves locals, hard to find but worth the search.  Soft Sour dough bread was so good! vegetarian sandwich, egg salad sandwich and hot pastrami on sourdough was great.  Onion roll was so yummy also.
author: Pamela L.

description:
Love their crunchy sourdough and mortadella!! I've been coming here for over five years. Better than any food chain sandwhich store. 

Choose Freddie's!
author: Mona A.

description: Been coming here since I was 13. Still tastes great! Italian combo is my favorite. You can't go wrong with Dutch crunch bread. They offer free spreads as well. Be sure to ask! Sandwiches may be toasted with no extra charge. You just have to ask! Drop by for lunch if you're in the neighborhood!
author: Michael C.

description: my go-to neighborhood sandwich shop. great selection, fast service and the owner doesn't mind that i read most of the SF Chronicle without paying for it.
author: David B.

description:
Out of towner looking for lunch after Alcatraz.  Wandered up the waterfront looking for something before walking up to Coit tower, didn't see anything I wanted bad enough to fight that crowd so checked on Yelp and found Freddie's.
Great Sandwiches!  Between us we had an Italian Combo, Buffalo Chicken and Corned Beef, all on soft sourdough, all delicious. The owner was at the register, very nice, very personable.  A lot of local folks in and out while we were sitting at a table outside eating.
BTW it's a lot easier to walk from the Fishermans Warf area up the streets to the Coit Tower past Freddie's than all those freaking stairs from the other direction.
author: Jeff M.

description:
I brought the family here for lunch on a Saturday, based on strong Yelp reviews. We were not disappointed. That was the best sandwich I've had in years.

There was no line to order, but a good dozen people waiting for food. Next time, I'll phone my order in from the road. I don't know if that's possible, but I'll definitely try. 

I live an hour away, but am already planning a return visit. I am fondly imagining stopping here with future houseguests on our way north from SFO. Yes, it's that good!
author: sayo n.

description: So good! Got the Black Forest ham on soft sourdough. Everything was fresh and delicious on my sandwich. Must come!
author: Christy L.

description: Love this place, their sandwiches never fail to make my heart happy. The meat is perfect, and the bread is always fresh. Pastrami and roast beef are my two go to sandwiches.
author: Selina G.

description: Authentic old time deli with great sandwhiches.  The traditional old North Beach Sandwich to order is the ham, cheese and salami with mustard on the Weidermeyer roll.  That's the traditional Italian sandwhich from the thirties that they have been making here since the 1930's.  It may not be the most interesting sandwhich they have here but it is a piece of SF history.
author: Bill S.

description: I order on line every time, very quick about 10 minute wait , I walk from my work when I order and its ready by the time I get there, some seating out side. Employees dont look miserable, that always makes me return to a business.
author: Citlali M.

description:
I have been a loyal customer of Freddie's since the mid 90's and I am proud to know that until this day, everything is running as it was back then. This establishment has been open for 89 years and counting... Eddie took over the place over 30 years ago and has been running the counter and taking orders since then. He always has a friendly demeanor and is a pleasure to speak with. 

There are specials available to the kids attending Francisco Middle School across the street. When they hear the final bell releasing them from the grind of a hard day of school, (ahhh... the good ol' days without a bill in your name) they come running over and line up to get their after school fix.

There are over 25 different sandwich combos for you to choose from. Last count I think there are 9 different breads including and not limited to sour dough, wheat oat and soft rolls to the best sweet dutch crunch this side of the Mission as well as sliced breads as well. 

There are plenty of cheese options available as well from cheddar to pepper-jack and don't forget the spreads! Garlic, Pepperoncini and the spreads of all spreads... The Jalapeno spread, it's a must have! Even if it's a light slathering... 

Eddie also stocks egg, tuna and carrot and raisin salads pre packed and ready to go as well as plenty of drinks, chips and candy so this place is a true definition of a one stop shop. 

***Office catering or family outing tip***

If you are in a crunch for a quick place to feed an army.. Okay maybe a lunch meeting, order a whole loaf sandwich and have Eddie and the ladies cut it into triangles! You will be surprised how filling and what a value it is. 

Snag a loaf and hop on a boat to Alcatraz and have a picnic that is fit for a king. 

Keep up the great work gang! We truly appreciate you all and this jewel of a sandwich shop. See ya soon!
author: Josh H.

description: Great sandwiches and good prices at an old school dive.
author: James A.

description: been going here for years, best affordable sandwiches i've ever had! do yourself a favor & try the "student combo"!
author: Melissa M.

description: Wow! Such an amazing sandwich. Had their vegetarian on soft sourdough. Awesome bread and their "small" size is super filling!!
author: Abhinav G.

description:
Best sandwhich shop in the city by far!
I've been coming here since 89'
Favorites are the Italian combo and hot pastrami on sour Soft roll awesomeness!
author: John L.

description:
I got sandwiches here over the weekend and was delighted to know this place hasn't changed since I was a kid (my dad used to buy me sandwiches from here growing up). The Italian Combo with soft sourdough was the best! So soft! 

The store is small and old-school, but they get the job done! Just wished it was in a more convenient location. Parking was easy to find.
author: Josh L.

description: Decent sandwich for a fair price at a nice little Italian store. Can recommend the Italian Combo.
author: Niklas S.

description: When its good it's good. Sandwiches,burgers,pizza are American Staples. Yet the difference between types of sandwiches and the quality can be striking. And getting a good sandwich is as difficult to obtain. Freddie's get's it right. The bread,meat,condiments,seasonings combined to form the perfect sandwich. I have tried the Italian combo,then ordered my own combo of roast beef,ham,turkey,lettuce,tomato,swiss cheese,mayo,mustard,oil vinegar...a pure gastronomical delight.  Now Freddie's is a market,get your sandwich and leave,it is a small market,so you may have to wait. But the wait is well worth it.
author: Jimmy L.

description:
I've been here a handful of times in recent visits to SF.  I like it because its quite near the tourist-y areas of the Embarcadero but far enough away that its not inundated with a lot of people.  They have really good sandwiches - I've had a veggie sandwich and a BLT, on sourdough of course!  

It does get pretty hot inside but there's ample seating outside so go ahead and order up and have a seat at one of the sidewalk tables.  You might see me there!
author: William H.

description: Great neighborhood deli with great food!  Similar sandwiches a few blocks away for the tourists are three times more.   I'll be back
author: Peter D.

description:
When we walked up at 11:45am to find utility workers and not one, but two different kind of cops cued up -- we felt pretty good.

Just a classic hole-in-the-wall sammich joint. If you can eat more than a "small" you are probably a weight-lifter. 

Do take the time to study the menu before you order -- not quite "no soup for you" but close. Just roll everything on whatever you get -- roasted turkey and corned beef are nice -- and consider one of the spreads to really amp it up. Had the hot jalapeno spread slammed on corned beef -- money.

Bonus: Grab your sammiches here, walk two blocks to the piers for a waterfront picnic, thumb your nose at the crappy, touristy junk for sale there.
author: Jeff T.

description: Nice, authentic sandwich shop. Quick friendly service. My bf got me hooked on the chicken salad on the soft sourdough bread. Good selection of drinks and chips to go with.
author: Carolyn S.

description: As good as it gets for classic Italian sandwiches. No hipster bullcrap. Good homemade sandwiches which will fill you up nicely. Decent prices. Cute benches outside to sit and enjoy those sammies.
author: Faizan J.

description: Two hairs in one tuna salad sandwich. Thanks! I would have recommended this place and I've been several times before, but that experience was completely unacceptable. Obviously very poor hygene standards. Not recommended.
author: Stephen B.

description: Holy crap. Such great sandwiches. I got the Italian combo and the corned beef, both on soft sourdough.
author: Nathaniel S.

description:
On my bookmarks for over 2 years and I knew I bookmarked it for a reason.  The reason was that it's freakin' delicious, that's why.  After our little adventure at the Ferry Building, Emmalouise and I were ready for lunch.  Emmalouise isn't picky so she let me decide.  I then allowed Yelp to navigate us here...

A small little sandwich joint about a 5 minute walk from Pier 39 that seems to be a convenience store as well.  No seating indoors but there are chairs outside so you can sit and use your lap as a table.  Unfortunately, I ate standing up because I was feeding the little one and I had to chase after him from time to time.  He's young and I can't imagine being in the stroller for hours so I let him be free during the duration of our meal.  

The guy at the counter isn't much of a customer service-y type of person and the wait for the sandwiches about 10 minutes (if toasted), more if there is a crowd however, if you want your sandwich cold then it'll be slightly shorter.  One thing I will note is that you should memorize what you order because they don't call your name when your sandwich is ready, they call out what you order.  Poor Emmalouise's sandwich got cold because some lady grabbed her sandwich even though the type of bread she ordered wasn't whole wheat... she held onto that thing for over 5 minutes.  The guy at the counter switched the sandwich after realizing the lady's dumb mistake but I did not hear him apologize to Emmalouise.

I ordered the small (6") corned beef, no tomatoes, no cheese on Dutch Crunch (can't have it any other way).  The bread was toasted just right w/ a slight crunch at first then deconstructed in my mouth awesomely.  The corned beef was sliced thinly and evenly but boy did they pile it up.  I loved it!  I'm a carnivore... the more meat, the better!  The lettuce was crisp and fresh and I love the mustard that eventually got into my hair.  What I love most was that the sandwich came out already cut and wrapped separately so for those trying to eat sensibly, this hella works!


The sandwich was great and I enjoyed our San Francisco trip together.  

I was FULL afterwards even though I only had half of it.  It was because Emmalouise baked and gave me some of the brownies (triple chocolate, yo).  It was moist, chewy, chocolaty, and delicious.  I'm trying to talk her into having her own baking business and/or have a bake date.
author: Tram N.

description: Best Club sandwich I have had in my entire life. Service is great and so many options to order ahead. I'll be a regular here for sure!
author: Aiden T.

description: All we wanted after visiting Alcatraz were some inexpensive awesome sandwiches, to eat on a plastic table on the public sidewalk, good people watching, annoy the employees by walking through their small kitchen to use their bathroom, and quick service with a little attitude. Was that too much to ask for? Apparently not, because this place delivered! (They don't deliver by the way, just takeout)
author: David S.

description: One of the best sandwiches I have ever had.  Hot pastrami & turkey  on soft sour dough bread.  Wide had the ham on white w/ everything.  Not to bad either.  A must visit when in SF.
author: Duane S.

description: Great little sandwich place at a solid price.  Ordering through yelp is super easy and makes waiting in line completely unneccessary!
author: Mike D.

description: Still THE BESTSANDWICHES IN THE BAY.  The Italian Combo on Soft Sourdough can't be beat.  I always add peppercinis and jalepeno spread (theres other spreads/topping which are all free).  You may be tempted to go to Columbus St near by and try that famous Italian deli thats been on TV .. not as good!!!  Went there and was disapointed.  The "small" at Freddie's is big enough for even hearty eaters.  A large is enough to easily feed 2 people.  Phone in your order cus theirs usually a line.  They have chairs for outdoor seating which is nice.
author: Neil C.

description: I've gone here way too many times for lunch and I'm reasonably confident that will not stop.  Great food.  It's very busy at lunch time.  Sometimes the wait is almost unreasonable.
author: Pavan G.

description: Love the old school deli near my work. I had a turkey on sliced sourdough with cheese and avocado, kettle chips and a craft root beer was a sweet combo...my standard deli order. Go there while you can, these places are disapearing quickly!
author: Maureen K.

description: Bomb diggity sandwiches for a nice day at the park. We always get the Italian combo. Highly recommend this spot!
author: Meg C.

description:
I take the 30 or 8x to visit my old neighborhood sandwich shop.  It is a harrowing ride between Kearny and Chinatown.  

Sometimes, I would see my crabby, humpty-dumpty shaped property manager at Freddies's. 

My personal fave is the focaccia roastbeef sandwich with jack cheese, onion, tomato, mayo.  

I have never seen Freddie himself make a sandwich, however.
author: Miran C.

description: Love this place! Excellent sandwiches and the friendliest owner ever! Support your local sandwich shops like this one. Forget the chains - Subway, etc.
author: Laura R.

description: Use to always come here during middle school to get their Freddie's special sandwich. Recently visited this place again and it's still satisfying.
author: Johnny N.

description: Great lunch spot with benches outside. Huge variety of sandwiches and even though this place is known for their meat, the veggie sandwiches are pretty bomb.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Use to order bread for 10 cents, 5 cents meat, 5 cent cheese. Still one of the best since I first went 45 years ago!!!
author: David S.

description: Amazing little deli! Take note: it closes at 4pm and isn't open on Sundays. The soft sourdough bread is incredibly delicious and a big reason this place is popular. While there aren't any frills about the establishment, and not much standing room, my family and I make the trip into San Francisco just for Freddie's Sandwiches. The Italian combo sandwich is a winner. Great and patient service, fresh ingredients.
author: Hannah C.

description:
I came here last Saturday afternoon and found that Freddie's does, in fact, live up to its Yelp reviews.  The top of the Dutch crunch bread is not as crunchy as Ike's, but the rest of it is so soft and chewy!!!   It can be so difficult to find such fresh sandwich bread sometimes!  The corned beef is nice and fresh and overall my friend and I got two solid sandwiches.  Even better, we were able to use a 50% Scoutmob coupon which made it a fantastic 5-star deal!  For the original price though, 4 stars.  Here is an up-to-date menu: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yGEc-cj9Quk5mUh7maoPXA?select=1zk4Pl1w5rColxa9ftXi1g

One thing to note though: on a warm day the store is really hot and stuffy because they don't even have a fan, but your sandwich will be well worth the wait and sweat. ;)
author: Beatrice W.

description: Absolutely perfect turkey sandwich prepared in no time at all! Highly recommend checking this awesome little place out! This was easily the highlight of my brief time in San Francisco. Great food and great prices.
author: Daniel B.

description: Our office recently moved to Telegraph Hill and just last week I tried Freddie's Sandwiches for the first time. Second time today. They have a huge list of options and after trying the pastrami and swiss first and the roast beef and cheddar today I am hooked! The soft sourdough roll is the best, a mix of easy to bite bread with a burst of sour that SF is known for. I have only gotten the small which is plenty big for a full grown male like me but many other sizes are available. I also like the fact that it is locally owned and operated so go out and support your local amazing sandwich place!
author: John The Best M.

description: Maybe the best sandwich I've ever had! We were in SF on vacation and needed to grab a quick bite on our way to an event. My husband found Freddie's on Yelp and I'm so glad he did! There wasn't anything fancy about the location or the sandwich, but the bread and meats were so fresh and good! I will make a point to visit Freddie's again the next time we're in SF!
author: Marc D.

description: Sweet dutch crunch, honey turkey, cranberry sauce!!!! I just can't get enough of Freddies, plus there's a student discount!
author: Tinai J.

description: Had the best sandwich ever at this long standing and established Italian shop. Owner is super friendly and prices are affordable. Blows Subway out of the water...
author: Cameron F.

description:
Freddie and his family are nice and consistent with their service. Dutch crunch is my favorite bread to get but soft sourdough is a close second.

They individually wrap each half of the sandwich and always offer a bag and don't charge for it (at least not yet).

Line can get pretty long around 12-12:30pm. Small sandwich will be enough for most and is under $6-7 usually. Large sandwich if you're hella hungry is around $8.
author: Eric C.

description: Truly one of the best sandwiches I've ever had! Unassuming shop with friendly and accommodating staff. Food is super fresh and made with care for sure! I had an egg salad sandwich on rye with all the fixins and would go back daily if I lived here!!
author: K O.

description:
As a visitor staying in the tourist area of fisherman's wharf. You never expect to find a gem like this place.

Our sandwiches were five star all the way. The service and cost was great.

  DM
author: Dino M.

description: My friend and I stopped by after the Alcatraz tour. SO GOOD!!! I got the veggie sandwich and added honey roasted turkey on sweet Dutch bread. MUST TRY! The garlic spread was delicious. We wanted to eat there a second time before leaving the city but it was closed on Sunday. Talk about bummer!
author: Allyson P.

description: One of the best sandwiches in town. If you're in the area, don't forget to stop by Freddie's. Yum!
author: Jai M.

description: I can definitely see what the hype is about. Had a great sandwich and received great customer service. Highly recommend!!
author: Danielle M.

description: Great sandwich shop in the North Beach area.  I ordered the Italian combo on the semi hard sourdough and my friend ordered the egg salad.   They have lunch meat and even mortadella which can be a difficult cold cut/ lunch meat to find.   Very affordable and huge portions. I ordered the small 6 inch sub and only ate half of my sandwich.  This place has only a couple spots outside to eat at a couple bistro tables.
author: Lisa W.

description:
This has become a go-to for lazy weekend pick-up sandwiches. Great variety of deli meat options available, or go all-in YOLO style and get the Italian combo. Bread-wise, my favorite is the semi-hard sourdough. Just hard enough to keep the sandwich together, yet soft enough that you don't squeeze out all of the toppings with that first big bite.

This is also somewhat of a mini mart, so great selection of drinks+chips.
author: Laura H.

description:
The 5-star Yelp review of yesteryear (double-parked work trucks clogging up the street in front of a lunch place) tipped me off to this beautifully simple-- but far from run-of-the-mill-- Italian sandwich shop.  Thanks, fellas!

Warning to pretentious food snobs:  the wonderfully drab interior of this sandwich shop will not translate well over Instagram and there is no Sonoma squab liver pate or tea leaves pooped out by monkeys on the menu.  

Head's up to my veggie brethren: the vegetarian sandwich is deliciously fresh, with a touch of herbaceous crunch.  It goes far beyond some boring-ass deli sandwich, hold the meat.  There's also a falafel option.

A tip for my girls who is always on diets:  the small (6") sandwich is just the right size for keister control.

To the adventurous eater posse:  there's herbs in the mustard that add a delicious brightness to your sammy.  There's also a freshly-baked sweet onion roll bread option, and you can add jalapeño or mild pepper spreads, garlic spread or even cranberry sauce to any sandwich. And of course, there's a wide variety of Italian cured meats.

Word up to children of the 70's and 80's:  they serve carrot and raisin salad.  No, I don't want to eat it!  But it's cool, right?

Freddie's has been around since 1926.  1926, beeches!  That's a lot of cumulative construction crew cred. (And also pretty much guarantees that Joe DiMaggio enjoyed a sandwich here, too, btw.)  Tucked away in that mildly unfashionable North Beach-slash-Fisherman's Wharf zone, it has somehow quietly survived douchefication and hippies and earthquakes and the middle school kids across the street, so you and I and every dude in a hard hat within two miles can enjoy a tasty sangwich.
author: Rosie W.

description: Great sandwiches from a friendly, family-run store opposite a middle school. Can't believe this is just a couple of blocks away from all the tourist traps at Fisherman's Wharf. For anyone staying nearby who needs a snack, it's definitely worth venturing off the beaten track to find this place.
author: Daniel B.

description: One of the best sandwich spots in the city. Consistent and great service/quality for your buck! Make sure to add that jalapeño spread for an extra kick! #Yum
author: Ian K.

description:
Damn fine sandwiches! So glad to have this deli nearby for lunch at work. Small takeout place. There is usually always a line and can get crowded inside. They do take call in orders, so I'll be doing that next time as our wait was about 15 minutes for our sandwiches. 

Club sammie on dutch crunch with everything. This was THEE softest dutch crunch that I've ever had. SOOOO good! 

Big selection of drinks and chips to choose from.
author: Christine R.

description: Great neighborhood sandwich shop. Ingredients are fresh, shop keepers are nice, and you get a nice fat sandwich for under $7 bucks.
author: Didi R.

description: Stumbled upon this place on our way to the pier. Nice option to grab a couple sandwiches and some drinks and take it to the pier to eat on the water. Small subs are huge. Very good!
author: Mario M.

description:
I've been going to Freddies off and on for over 40 years.   I love that it's still a genuine neighborhood place to get a real italian combo sandwich.   No Jive....just great sandwiches and great service and great memories.    Thank You Freddies.
My fave is the italian combo with pepperoncini on hard sour roll.....
Used to get similar at the old  Portofino Cafe and the  Bohemian Cigar Store from Mario but Freddies is the original.   A real genuine slice of San Francisco.
author: Hollis K.

description: This place was quick and easy enough to order but don't be intimidated by all the choices. I didn't get my small hot Italian combo with the spread but next time I will remember to add that! More space or seating would be nice but you can always walk to the wharf and sit on the benches there.
author: Nancy Y.

description:
FREDDIES is a San Francisco institution.  Have been going here - for probably 20 years or more.
The office loves the whole loaf combo with extra turkey.  The special bake sourdough bread is delicious - and Freddie's is the only place you can get it.
Great for an office lunch, to take to the ball park - or last minute party at the house.
Love this place!
author: Jeanne B.

description: This place is great. I got a regular turkey sandwich with the dutch crunch bread. The meat was great, but I wasn't a fan of the bread.. I think I'll have to try to softer rolls. I ordered online and was able to pick up in less than 10 min.
author: Alison R.

description: Another great sandwich shop we went to in SF. It's been open since 1926 and the staff was friendly, service was good, and the sandwiches were tasty.
author: Art T.

description:
After working around the corner from Freddie's for about 1.5 years, I realized a few things. 

1. I took this excellent sandwich place for granted. 
2. I no longer have an excellent sandwich place to take for granted. Sad sandwich feelings ensue. 

I work too far away to enjoy the many shiny reasons to frequent Freddie's' fine fare, but if you find yourself within reach, make your stomach available for an appointment.

This is a friendly local establishment that has been in business for many years, and you can really see why. The sandwich options are endless, full of fresh, tasty ingredients that make your sammy attain those important sammy standards. The prices make so much sense that you'll feel great leaving (much earned) tips. The staff and the owner cannot get any more friendly or else you'll be in danger of barfing rainbows. The ordering process makes me smile: either show up or call ahead and describe your ideal sandwich, and it shall be done. 

Other bells and whistles:
- They take debit cards but they also have an ATM onsite. 
- They have a fridges packed with every specialty beverage imaginable that even the whiniest lunch beverage connoisseur would twitch with indecision. 
- They have massive collection of various kinds of chips to add crunch to your lunch.
- Screw the sandwiches you want candy, cookies, and/or baklava? Your sweet tooth can come here too. You can also find potato salad and falafel here as well if you come here and for some reason are in a sandwich-shunning mood. 

If you're still in an advice taking mood and have a penchant for veggie sandwiches, their veggie sandwich is magically delicious. I always got the small veggie, toasted wheat roll, with pepper jack cheese, and the combination unlocked unprecedented lunch serotonin. Their tuna salad is also extremely tasty business. 

Take your sandwich away to Washington Square Park and have a ridiculously lovely picnic, or sit outside on one of their plastic chairs and you are sam-tastically set for success.
author: Chelsea B.

description:
Italian Combo on Dutch Crunch with extra spicy spread.  A bottle of sparking water and a bag of baked lays.  That, my friends, is the cure for the common hangover.

Also tasty, hot copa and deli turkey on a soft onion roll. 

You have to make the trek up the hill to Molinari if you want to find a better sandwich in the neighborhood.
author: Alex H.

description:
Italian combo on sweet dutch with the pepper spread:) So. Good. 

Everything tastes fresh and although the prices seem a little steep, the sandwiches are huge and can last for two meals. 

The only thing I've tried from here that I haven't been too crazy about is the falafels on pita bread.
author: Fiana L.

description: Pretty good sandwich, but the wait was way too long to make it worth it. Placed an order online through yelp24 with an estimate of 10-35min til pickup. I showed up at the 15min mark, hoping it would be ready sooner rather than later- I ended up waiting about 45min for it to be ready. Just wish they could've given me a better estimate. Wasted most of my lunch break waiting. And there's no organization to the line to order/ area to wait.
author: Minna B.

description: Oi, we ordered two club sangers (that's Australian for sandwiches) using Yelp online order and pickup. The service time, value and taste were all tops. I recommend it, yummo.
author: Jeremy C.

description:
The highlight of my workday!  I yearn to come here every day M-F. Always fresh brewad delivered every morning, great customer service and prices to boot. 

MUST HAVE the soft sourdough roll with either the Italian Special, Salami, or Turkey combo. No sando in city compares. 

The garlic sauce is a nice extra, but all the sandwiches already come packed with flavor so you don't absolutely need it.
author: Gabriel C.

description: My review is for yesterday way back in years.  I used to come here after school at Galileo. In those days, there were no lettuce or others, we just had the plain deli meat with the french bread. It was super cheap..I still craved those sandwiches made back then.  Bread super soft, lots of meat, 30 or 50 cents worth of deli meat onto the sandwich.  I really need to go by there now, and try their sandwiches, made in today's style.
author: M. Ann W.

description:
I live across the street from this place, so convenience is definitely a plus, but despite that Freddie's is a great neighborhood sandwich store! 

A good bang for your buck. If their sandwich doesn't fill you up, I don't know what will. 

The things about their sandwiches that I like a lot is that they're clean and easy to eat (Keep in mind, their hard sourdough is REALLY hard, if you're not a fan of hard crusted breads, then go with the semi-hard or even the soft). And by clean I mean you won't have that sandwich-tomato-mayo-mustard-meat-juice dripping all over the place like many other large sandwiches do. 

I recommend the Smoked Turkey on Semi-Hard Sourdough with everything and Garlic Spread (I omit mayo since I'm not a fan).

Aaaand if you like getting a light buzz with your sandwich, they also sell canned/bottled beers.

Cheers.
author: Vencenza S.

description:
I literally live next door to this gem, but this is the first time I've had their sandwiches. These are old-school, no frills sandwiches which are just plain awesome. This is a small grocery-style store with lots of other randoms for sale (gum, snacks, drinks.) The service is friendly and is the definition of "mom and pop."

The menu is a bit confusing- there are so many items and it's unclear what you're supposed to be picking. But once I navigated through the complex menu, it was well worth it when I got my sandwich tidily wrapped up in halves. 

I ended up getting the small Italian combo on whole wheat roll. The wheat roll was soft, light, and had just the right consistency- not too hard but not stale either. The Italian combo is filled with a generous amount of yummy Italian deli meats, lettuce, great mustard, pickles, onions, and a slice of cheese. WOW. Everything was simple but executed perfectly. I want to come here all the time!!
author: Cathy S.

description: After our tour to Alcatraz we were looking for a quick bite to eat within walking distance from pier 33. Thanks to the Yelp reviews we decided to try this little hole in the wall sandwich shop. So glad we did. It was delicious!  My husband and I both got the italian sub. I had it on a crunch roll and he had oatmeal wheat. Both were fantastic. If you are looking for a delicious deli sandwich- make the trip to Freddies
author: Lisa C.

description:
I don't really like sandwiches, actually I avoid them if at all possible, but I have come here at least once a week to get lunch for work for the past 3 months.
