My friend always orders the salami sandwich on soft bread, but I really like their tuna sandwich. It's hard to find a good tuna sandwich because preferences among people vary so much, but I regularly order this at Freddie's and I am a fan. There's really not very much crunchy celery (which I don't like) and they add cheese. Of course, they will make it any way you like it, but I LOVE tuna sandwiches with cheese. 

They are friendly, personal, and will remember you. They have chips, drinks, and sides available as well. I always get aloe juice here. yuMMm.
author: Andy M.

description: Yum! Beat the tourist traps and come here for lunch! The spicy falafel was delicious!
author: K S.

description:
Best crafted sandwich in San Francisco.  

Always order on their soft sourdough.  Tasty bread which I can't find anywhere else.  Bread makes the sandwich.  Bring your appetite.  Big sandwiches.
author: John K.

description: Best sandwich place I have ever had. I love Freddie's and have been going here for years. Make sure to come early or wait in line.
author: Aleks M.

description: Great sandwiches! It's all about their bread. I always get the sweet Dutch rolls...delicious!
author: John D.

description:
Good sandwiches. Reasonable prices. Prompt, courteous service. 

Chef recommends!
author: West R.

description: Holy crap was this place amazing. You could tell just by the line out the door. I eat a lot in one sitting but take my advice and get the small. My GF and I were feeling ambitious and both ordered larges. Let's just say we had plenty of leftovers for an afternoon snack.
author: Charles H.

description:
mom and pop deli with great made to order sandwiches. decently priced for the area. 

that said... unless you get a large sandwich. I would ask them NOT to cut your sandwich. Today, I ordered a small (~6") sandwich on dutch crunch  sandwich and the lady that made it cut it TWICE. WTF. so my small sandwich is in three pieces and do you know how hard it is to keep a sandwich together when it's big? THINK about it when each piece is about 1.5 -2" wide. I may as well have eaten this as bread salad. maybe she spaced out and thought she should fix it so all the pieces would be even but you know what lady? EFF YOU!
author: sasa w.

description: These are the best sandwiches ever!!! We got a club, Italian and a veggie!!! They were packed with meat/veggies and the bread is delicious.... Next time we are in town we will definitely go back....
author: Kim M.

description:
I just had a spectacular sandwich today at Freddie's.  I got the honey roasted turkey breast with avocado, tomato, and lettuce on a soft sourdough roll.  Amazing!  Next time I want to try the Italian.  

Service was great, quality was awesome, and prices were very reasonable.
author: Mara M.

description:
Was driving around looking for something to eat and found this place. Didn't see all the positive reviews so I tried it with an open mind. First off, this is the kind of place I love to go to - local store, chill and friendly vibe, people seemed friendly and nice.

Got the club on onion bread for me and a turkey on wheat roll for my wife. Both sandwiches were huge, stuffed to the gills with meat. The meat seemed fresh and the bread seemed pretty good; but both didn't wow me like it has others. There wasn't any special sauce or anything out of the ordinary; they didn't have any special meat from a hidden source or flown in from out of town anywhere; nor did the bread tasted like it was from a special bakery somewhere. It was two decent sandwiches made to fill you up. 

Later on I noticed they do have other types of spreads (garlic/jalapeno, etc) and many seemed to recommend the italian combo. I'll definitely try it next time. That reminds me, for someone who was going for the first time, the menu seemed a bit large and intimidating. And I even looked at the menu for a long time. 

Will try again when I'm in the area, hopefully I'll pick something better that might wow me.
author: Dom L.

description: This place is right down the street from where I live, and I'm so happy I live where I do, partly because of Freddie's.  They consistently provide amazing sandwiches for good prices and without the frills.  It feels like a true Italian Deli inside, and I am always so happy when I eat my sandwich!  Love this place!
author: Courtney S.

description:
This our favorite sandwich shop. It's had several owners over the years; however, the concept is the same. You order off the sandwich board; sandwich is made; your order is called; then you pay. 

My favorite bread is the soft sourdough. It's one of their original offerings. Sandwiches come in various lengths starting with the 6" up to an entire loaf. 

I always order the roast beef on a soft sourdough with jalapeno pepper spread. 

My husband raved about his hot pastrami and cheese toasted on a hard sourdough. He said it was the best ever. It took 15 minutes prep time, but he said it was worth the wait. 

Freddie also takes phone orders and fax orders. There's always a line of students and office workers, but it's one of the best sandwich places in the City. I like it much better than Ike's which I think is overrated and over hyped. 

Once in a blue moon we'll order an entire loaf. They'll cut the loaf into party bite size pieces. Great for a picnic.
author: Shirley N.

description: One of top 5 sandwiches lifetime. Italian combo with provolone, oil and vinegar, and jalapeño spread on soft sourdough. Wow!
author: rick r.

description:
Nice service and fair price, but honestly I've had sandwiches that were way better.

I was lucky and beat the lunchtime rush by a few minutes to order a sandwich. When I walked in, there were only two other people in there. A few minutes later, after I ordered, I turned around and a line had formed going out the door and starting to turn the corner of the block. I guess a lot of people really like this place.

I ordered hot pastrami on soft sourdough. I liked the bread, but out of the rest of the sandwich I could only taste the mustard. I don't mind mustard that much, just not when it overpowers the taste of the rest of the ingredients. Also, the sandwich was pretty drippy, and it didn't help that I was eating it in my car and I didn't have any napkins.

Maybe I'll have better luck next time if I decide to try this place again.
author: Allen C.

description:
Great sandwiches. I especially like anything on their "Soft Sourdough" bread. It's all about the bread!

Few issues keep it out of 5-star territory:

First, seating. Benches and plastic chairs outside. Small plastic "coffee tables" too, but no proper tables, and nowhere to sit inside. In that regard, I prefer Subway or Togo's.

Second, Menu. It's too complicated. Ask for a turkey sandwich, and he'll ask "which kind?". Look, I'm a simple guy. How about the TURKEY kind of turkey sandwich? (note to the uninitiated: the "Deli Turkey" is the cheapest).

Third, when he asks "Any cheese?", it feels like an upsell, which I don't like. First time, I heard it as "And the cheese?"--as if the sandwich comes with cheese; the only decision being the kind I'd prefer (again, this is how Subway and Togo's work). But no, he's saying "any cheese?", which really means: "That sandwich doesn't come with cheese (although some of our other sandwiches do); would you like to pay extra to get some?". Some might see this as kind guidance to build the perfect sandwich; I see it as a way to get another 43 cents out of me. Look, you're the sandwich maker here, not me. If you think cheese is good on that sandwich, how about including it in the sandwich and adjusting the price accordingly? Can I please just get a yummy sandwich without doing a cost-benefit analysis? Thanks.
author: No C.

description: Very good!! They use a lot of meat and the bread was fresh. Very filling! I wish I had one in Chicago!
author: Brandi S.

description:
First time I saw this place, I dismissed it as a typical corner store deli shop. Thankfully, due to my girlfriends past experience with Freddie's Sandwiches, I gave it a shot.

They did not let me down.

The minute you walk in, you see a great selection if sandwiches to order from. The notion of it being just any old deli was dismissed. It was a LEGIT deli store committed to it's Sandwiches. 

You have the option of a small, medium, large sandwich or even a monster sized length. The small size itself is quite large despite it's "small" label.

 Various options of bread are available from my favorite Dutch crunch, to sourdough, French, soft sourdough, etc. You can choose from one of several meats and have the sandwich engineered to your own likings. 

Freddie's is a fantastic spot and reasonably priced. The only downside is there is no real dedicated eating area with only a bench out in front or setting up your own table from provided chairs and table. This is the only reason I couldn't rank it a 5 star spot. Maybe in the near future it'll be possible to install some sort of eating area or tables around the deli, but since it's North Beach it wouldn't hurt to walk to a nice area to eat.

Overall, great taste, good prices, wide selection and located in s nice, chill area. Freddie's is the place to go if your in the area and mood for a sandwich.
author: Jesus A.

description: Large sandwiches old school deli style. If you are hungry get the large, but the small is plenty to suffice. The beverage options are plentiful and the candy selection is a nice touch.  Great friendly service!
author: Rob M.

description:
I should be ashamed of myself. I've lived around the corner from this place for almost three years and I just made my way there this week. If there is one thing about NY it's heroes, hoagies, grinders, subs...you get the idea. So when I finally made it in this place I was very excited to see what the results would be.

Freddie's did not disappoint. I love heroes and they came through for me. There are only a couple of sandwich spots in SF that I would recommend and go back to and this would be one of them. One make-or-break factor is the amount of meats, cheeses, etc. This thing was piled high with meat and other ingredients and that makes me happy. How lame is it when you hear all over town about some amazing sandwich just to get one there and see two or three pieces of whatever? I hate that and will never order another one - ever!

Not a fancy place (and a deli/sandwich shop doesn't have to be), good heroes, nice staff, and a decent price. I'm now a fan of Freddie's!
author: Gabriel R.

description: Wow my family and I spent a day in SF. Well it came to that we were getting hungry. Well we wanted something authentic good and full filling. Well this sandwich shop had what I was looking for a little Shop in a hole, the sandwiches we got were Italian combo and hot pastrami and turkey with pesto. Man the Best sandwiches we all have had. FULL FILLING & DELICIOUS!
author: E C.

description:
This is one of those Italian delis that I'd probably never have tried without the rave reviews from Yelpers since it's way out in North Beach on a quiet side street away from all the action.

But find it I did and I went straight for the italian combo on sweet dutch bread.  I didn't get a chance to eat it for about an hour afterwards but even then it tasted really good.  The spiciness from the generous heaps of salami, cotto and other Italian meats balance nicely with the sweet roll, although I still prefer the dutch crunch version which they don't have.   

Nice deli option if you're ever in that part of town.
author: F. P.

description:
Pretty good sandwiches and very filling. Don't let the 6' size fool u. It's stacked with meat and I couldn't even finish it. I had the Italian combo. Really good. Also roast beef was good. And the freshly sliced meats made all the difference with the selections of bread made these sandwiches worth coming back for. Prices decent for the size of sandwiches. I don't think anyone should really order anything larger than 8" as it would be too much food for one person. 
There are no tables to eat here bu they do supply chairs to eat outside if you wanted to eat which we did right away.
author: Mrs H.

description: My family has been going there for over 30 years and it is my favorite deli to visit! The Italian combo is traditionally what my family orders.
author: Anna H.

description:
Italian combo on soft sourdough, the most awesome sandwich in the world for around $6 bucks! Not to mention Freddie's carry other great bread varieties such as dutch crunch, wheat, etc. 

I can probably eat this everyday if this place wasn't so far away! And if you take the sandwich to go, you can easily walk towards pier 39 for a better view and a relaxing lunch break.
author: Ming S.

description:
This place is a local favorite that has been around since the twenties.  

You can choose from over twenty five different sandwiches.  I have never tried a sandwich here that wasn't outstanding.  

My go to favorite is pastrami, cheddar, everything, jalopenos, heavy mayonnaise, served hot on dutch crunch!

You owe it to yourself to get your butt down to Freddie's for one of his famous creations.
author: Jason S.

description:
I have lived in the neighbored for 7 years and I have never heard of Freddie's. After I found a deal on scout mob I figured that Freddie's had to be a new place. Nope I was so wrong it has been in NB for over 85 years.

Very small establishment but the sandwiches are very big. I ordered the smoked turkey it was perfect. I could only eat half it was so big. I am a very picky eater and they made the sandwich the way I wanted it with out a fuss like some places do.

They have a small beer selection so it is great to grab a sandwich, beer and a cookie and sit outside and enjoy.

I am a fan for sure and now that I no it is so close to home I am sure you will be seeing a lot more of me.
author: Christian A.

description:
This is a small convenience store/deli and it definitely does not disappoint.

I love a good Italian hoagie over here on the east coast and the Italian combo at Freddie's can hold it's own.  The bread is soft and delicious.  All the meats and cheeses were fresh and tasty.  And they are HUGE.  Only go into the large if you are really bringing a big appetite.

There are only a few seats outside, but with a short walk you can be at the water and enjoy a great sandwich with a great view.
author: Mark H.

description:
I came to Freddie's because a friend told me how good it was years ago when she went back in middle school. I was not disappointed, in fact, in all honesty it has to be one of the best ,if not the best sandwich spot in  San Francisco with great prices. The salami is perfect because it has some of the natural oil and it compliments the mayo. The mustard was standard. A nice touch was the way the lettuce was shredded because it wasn't messy. The sweet dutch that they use is truly one of a kind.

The sweet dutch has a sweet after taste that gives their sandwiches a unique touch. The bread isn't chewy either, or rough like other sandwich places. It has an old feel to it by the way the interior looks. It just one of those spots you have to try. They close at four so you better hurry, I promise it's worth it!
author: Pansy A.

description: This is my favorite sandwich shop in the entire city. I live in north beach and it's always my go to place. I love everything about it, thinking about this  place just makes me happy :) my only complaint is that I wish it was open later so I could go more often! I guess it just makes my Saturday's that much better!
author: Melissa T.

description:
Came here many a weekend when i lived in North Beach. A little tucked away, which is nice that all the tourists dont know about it. The employees work very hard to craft a well-made sub sandwich made to order. I always got the turkey, so cannot speak to the quality of the italian meats.

The sandwiches are reasonably priced, so look to spend about $10-$12 on a sandwich and drink. Closed on sundays.
author: Jeremy K.

description: I got the Italian combo on sweet Dutch with hot pepper spread. It was fantastic. The meat was piled high and the pepper spread was the perfect lunch heat, not too much to make you want to relax your tongue after each bite.  My wife got the sweet turkey with everything and said the pickles and onion were perfectly distributed making each bite excellent. Would love to come back if we come back to the bay area.
author: Aaron L.

description: Best place ever!! Came to Frisco on a vacation and decided to try out this place and it was extremely good! The sandwich that was probably the best I've had here is the turkey pastrami on whole wheat bread and I got it hot! Talk about flavor this sandwich had it all!! Delicious!!
author: Anthony C.

description: My only regret is not ordering a small size of the Italian Combo. Great food, greater portion sizes. Plus it got that old school cool. No regrets.
author: Brendan G.

description: I come here about once a week for the Italian combo (- onion + pepperoncini) and this gigantic sandwich never disappoints. The sourdough bread is delicious, and a small is plenty big for my equally enormous appetite.
author: Bryan V.

description:
Simple, generous portion and delicious - that's Freddie's.  The sandwich is made the way I remember from my school days and it's just as good today as it was years ago.

Freddie's is definitely a favorite to the kids from Francisco but it's also a local favorite, as well as tourists.

A large Italian combo is only $7.75, they half and wrap it up separately for you without asking.  You can enjoy your sandwich right outside at one of the two benches or help yourself with the stackable chairs and tables.  Just be sure to clean up after yourself - garbage and recycle cans available at your convenience.

Great selection of soft drinks and chips including Dirty and Kettle.
author: Gloria H.

description: Clean little sandwich shop, nice variety,  hefty sandwiches,  jalapeño paste on whatever sandwich is a must try.
author: Ron P.

description:
I order from this place through Gopago. Freddie's is fast and tasty. I love the Italian roll with sourdough. It's fresher than Subway and a lot tastier. Everytime I'm there the staff is very friendly and accomodating.

There's barely any parking nearby because it's residential mostly. I park on Bay St. and walk up a block to pick my sandwich up.
author: Johnny D.

description: My new go-to for a sandwich fix. I order from them using OrderAhead and it's always ready to go when I arrive. I recommend for take-out only. I subtract a star because it's a bit pricey (yay SF), ambiance is nil, and their non-sandwich options don't look very appetizing. Regardless I definitely recommend Freddie's!
author: Emmy A.

description: Everyone had written great reviews about the Italian combo and I'm a sucker for that at any sandwich place so of course I had to get it.  It was packed with a lot of meat and the bread was really good too which made a good meal.  I still think there are other places in the city that have better Italian combos like Molinari's but I'll still take it.
author: Blake B.

description:
Italian Combo Sammie rocks!

Piled high with meaty goodness on fresh sourdough.  Friendly service and fast if you show up around 3:30 on a Saturday afternoon.  Even easy to park.  

Not hard to understand why this gem of an Italian Deli has lasted 86 years.

Wishing them (& me) 86 more!
author: Lxs S.

description:
I ordered a large(8in) Italian Combo with garlic spread, and pepper jack cheese with Sweet Dutch bread and a 1/2 pint of potato salad with a friend. We splited the sandwich and the potato salad. Both of our stomaches and tastebuds were satisfied.

Pros:
- sandwich doesn't get as messy as any other sandwiches.
- gives lots of meat
- really tasty
- friendly cashier that remembers who ordered what

Cons:
- long line ( even on a regular Monday afternoon )
- the only place you can sit and eat are the 3 benches provided outside. There are also some green plastic chairs stacked at the corner of the street.
- they don't have a toaster so they use the microwave

I will be coming back for another sandwich, but I'd recommend to come here only if you're going to just order and go. The wait might be around 15mins depending on how long the line is.
author: Kelly H.

description:
Freddie's puts BK'S "Have It Your Way" and Subway's "Eat Fresh" motto shame! 

They say police officers always know where good eats are and it's true. I always see local PD waiting to get their sandwiches here and for good reason; this shop has much history and the sandwiches are legit. 

All it takes become a successful sandwich shop is good bread, fresh ingredients, piles of meat, and make it fresh to order -- all of which Freddie's delivers.

My favorite is the hot pastrami on dutch with the works and don't forget the jalapeno spread for a spicy kick!
author: Albert L.

description: One of my favorite old school San Francisco sandwich shops. I like the Italian combo. Bs da bing ba da boom
author: Joe M.

description: I love Freddies- a Northbeach institution that is delicious. Great food and great atmosphere. Make sure to call ahead if it is the lunchtime hour to avoid the wait!
author: Peter F.

description:
Ahhh....this place takes me back to my grade school days.  Use to leave my house early just to go pick up a sandwich here before our school field trip.  This place you use to be able to order your sandwich by the ingredients.  My sandwich order would be typically:

25 cent salami
10 cent cheese
15 cent bread 

Then they would slice the meat, slice the cheese and the bread and hand it to you on the butcher paper and you would take it over to the table and build your sandwich.  Bread....with a spread of mustard and the Salami.  Wrap it up and bag it and take it to school!!  This was the place to get a sandwich back in the days.

Today, sandwiches are made to your order.  They have fresh bread to chose from, various meats and cheese....of course the lettuce and tomatoes and pickles.  Large selection of drinks and it is only $5.00 and up for a sandwich.  The best part of the sandwich is that the bread comes in daily so it's nice and fresh.  

I had the French Roll Salami Sandwich yesterday.  Fresh French Roll, nice and crunchy on the outside, nice and soft on the inside.  Lots of Salami with a touch of mustard and to top it off with a couple of slices of Pepper Jack Cheese.

Still taste good as back in the days!!  Of course it's a little more than 50 cents.

If your visiting Pier 39 or in the area....you might want to drop by this place for a sandwich.
author: Alan L.

description: If you are looking for a quick bite to eat, this is the place to go! The sandwiches are made fresh to go and every bite is enjoyable.
author: Whet Z.

description: Super fresh ingredients! Great, always friendly service.  They can get busy so order ahead.
author: Renee E.

description:
Cool things that are in their 80s: My grandparents. Freddie's.

The former would probably love the latter. An awesome selection of meats (honey roasted turkey!), breads (wheat rolls!), veggies (something about shredded lettuce works so well on sandwiches) and extras (cranberry sauce is a reasonable extra $0.35 and you get a lot of it).

All expertly and quickly put together and served with a confident "we've been doing this since 1926" smile. The sandwich was a strong four stars, history earns them the full five.

Wishing both my grandparents and Freddie's good health and good sandwiches for years to come.
author: Jason B.

description:
I wish Freddy's was all around the city, they are the best!
And the different sandwich are so different that you will find yours.
Italian combo on onion bread that's mine!
author: Antoine P.

description:
Was in the area and stopped by for one of their sandwiches, which run around $6.20 on up.
I had the smoked turkey with everything.  Love the shredded lettuce, but not enough pickels and I need to remember to ask for more mustard.  It was salty but good on the sourdough.
Tried a bite of hubby's pastrami - too salty for me.
Jr. Yelper 1 had the smoked chicken and said it was OK.
They have a large fridge with lots of beverages and individual sized as well as large bags of chips on display.  
The man who takes your orders isn't very friendly.  He's like a sandwich Czar while the 3 ladies next to him are busy making the sandwiches.  I guess they taste good enough that regulars keep coming back. He greets them with a tone that tells you he knows them but unlike other small businesses, most of the regulars usually hang around and chat.  He doesn't have customers who do that.  He's almost on the grumpy side.

The sandwiches are reasonably priced, definitely cheaper than what you'd get at Ike's but the staff at Ike's are friendlier and their sandwiches are double the price.
A lot of the regulars call ahead for their sandwiches, or order by phone ahead.
author: Ry T.

description: The hot coppa on a soft roll is so good. Get the spicy spread and tell them to pile the coppa high! San Francisco is a tough sandwich competition. Spots like Ike's take all the glory (and rightly so) but Freddie's deserves its day. Love this place and try to stop by whenever I'm in north beach mid day.
author: Mike D.

description: I have to say this sandwich was pretty underwhelming.  I got a turkey and ham with provolone, all the vegetables and garlic sauce.  It really lacked flavor all around, I'm not sure what they use for their garlic sauce but they should consider some scapes instead of parsley.  Dutch crunch bread was too chewy.  Most likely won't be coming back.
author: Naps V.

description:
Freddie's has consistently been the best sandwich shop in North Beach for many years. I am not a vegetarian but their vegetarian sandwich with avocado, provolone, lettuce, tomato, garlic spread and pepper spread is simply divine. Try it on a toasted Dutch Crunch roll. I used to work 3 blocks away and got lunch at Freddie's 2x a week.
The owner is a generous and warmhearted soul.
author: David W.

description: Loved this place. Italian Combo on Wheat Oat and a Ham & Turkey on Soft Sourdough, both really delicious, stand out bread and mustard just made it. Friendly people and a nice quiet bench outside to eat, only a couple blocks easy walk from Pier 39 and so worth it!
author: Jessica H.

description:
Have you heard the phrase, "I'm so hungry, I can eat a horse" ? 

(More like, Matt can eat a pair of horses or relialistically, two super burritoes). 

Indeed I'm capable of doing the impossible, but my empty stomach and fatigue body couldn't survive the drive to the Mission District for a burrito. So I settled to this North Beach Deli to fill up my empty tank, which is also close to my crib. 

This deli is located right across the street from a middle school, but fortunately, the deli is off-limits for the youngsters during midday. The menu selection is pretty selective and standard like most delis. I was so hungry that I bought "three" sandwiches; all for me. Selfish, am I?

My first sandwich is a tuna salad on a wheat bread. My second was a Vegetarian with a Provolone cheese on a Dutch Crunch (Just the usual fillings with sprouts, cucumbers, avocado and cheese without the meat). And my final one is a Falafel sandwich (bunch of falafels halves with a scoop of Tahini and Tiboulli). My three sandwiches including a bottle of Lemonade Snapple totalled to $22.00. Cash is all they accept, but there is an ATM Machine inside with a fee charged. 

The friendly lady that prepared my sandwiches saying that, "you must have some hungry people?"

I replied, "Yeah, me!" 

(She looked at me shockingly)

She asked, "Are you going to eat "all three" sandwiches?"

I replied hurriedly, "You bet I am!"

I drove home quickly, locked the doors and ate and enjoyed all three sandwiches in one-hour. 

(You can tell I was extremely hungry).
author: Matt G.

description: This place been making sandwiches for years. Very large selections of meat and bread. Recommend you order a large sandwich that way you can eat half and save the other half for later.
author: LL Y.

description:
Freddie's sandwich shop has been making delicious sandwiches in San Francisco since 1926. The primary location of this little neighborhood gem is Francisco and Stockton in North Beach. It's an institution for people who grew up in the neighborhood and went to Francisco Middle School. It's quite entertaining and timeless to see the kids line up for sodas, sandwiches and candy. The second location just opened up on Pine and Polk in the Polk Gultch neighborhood and I couldn't be happier. Our closest sandwich shop was Whole Foods which is barely passable compared to Freddie's. 

Best things about Freddie's are the super nice people who work there. It clearly is a family joint and it shows. Service with a smile but that warm grandparent type smile. My favorite sandwich is the chicken salad with the pepercini spread. Yum! The dutch crunch is amazing and the drink selection endless. I love this place.
author: Alice S.

description: I have been coming here for almost 10 years and each time is as good as the previous. I always get the small chicken salad  sandwich with everything on hard sourdough, so I can't give any advice on anything else! It is the best chicken salad ever. I have seen the italian combo and that looks good. It is a whole lot of meat, so be hungry. Over the weekend I went and we were just enjoying our sandwiches on the bench and multiple people stopped to chat and reminisce about when a freddie's sandwich used to cost you 9 cents, it was great. Best sandwich in s.f.!!
author: ashley m.

description: Freddie's is awesome. Great sandwiches with a huge variety of breads, meats, and cheeses. Fresh ingredients and quality service. They always get it right at Freddie's!
author: Paul H.

description:
All I can say is that it's a good thing that Freddie doesn't deliver otherwise I'd be eating his sandwiches for every meal.

They are generous with fillings and large enough for two meals.  How they stay in business with their reasonable prices is beyond me but I'm darn glad they are.  Reasonable I mean.

In a neighborhood of sandwiches that have been over done this is the best!
author: Stitch H.

description:
A+ ! 

I recently moved to sf and found an apt in north beach. I was wandering around my neighborhood hungry the day after I moved in and saw this sandwich shop. I picked the first item on the menu, italian combo on onion bread and took it home to each. BOY WAS I SATISFIED! for about 6 bucks you can get a delicious sandwich that will leave you looking forward to the next time you can come by again! 

This place caters to the businesses around the area so they are only open til about 4pm.
author: omid a.

description:
Hidden gem few blocks up from my new workplace. 6 inch, hot pastrami, sweet dutch crunch, with everything on it, minus cheese, add jalapeno spread and garlic spread. You've got yourself a monster of a sandwich, without the monstrous sizes of Little Lucca or Ike's. Btw this is the only place that I've ever been to that has a "sweet" dutch crunch, pretty darn good.

 Food coma, you shall not pass!
author: Jamie C.

description: I remember back in my middle school days at Francisco, Every time when, I hear the school bell ring for lunch. I would run out from my classroom and into Freddie's just to have their famous sandwiches. It all depends on how fast you can get there. There were some other students that were faster than me and sometimes the lines can get really crowded with alot of students. But that did not matter to me after when, I had gradulated from Francisco Middle School. I did come back again to buy their sandwiches once again and this time without those students who once had beat me to the line just to buy a sandwich from Freddie's.
author: William B.

description: I'm not quite sure what all the raves are about. A fine sandwich place, but again, nothing (yet) beats Marina Subs.
author: Amy W.

description: I'm visiting from Austin, Texas and my BnB is nearby. I got a sandwich from Freddie's and wandered down to the Pier for people watching and it was great. The service was friendly and FAST! I'll probably visit again before I leave town.
author: Cecily J.

description: My family has been coming here since they were students at Francisco across the street.. So I grew up since Birth on this place!!! The OG Italian Combo on soft roll is the BEST!!! Can't go wrong! Love it here!
author: Ray L.

description:
Freddie's is my favorite neighborhood sandwich shop. They make the best Italian Combo in North Beach, their meats are just a bit tastier and fresher than everyone else's, and it's simply heavenly on a soft sourdough roll.

I have a really big appetite, but a small is good enough for me. When I'm working from home, my favorite lunch is to grab an Italian Combo and a Ginger Beer from Freddy's, then head over a couple blocks to Washington Square to finish it off. 

Freddie also makes pretty good hot toasted sandwiches as well. I highly recommend getting a toasted corned beef with swiss. Yum!

Because Freddie's kicks ass, there can be a long wait during the noon lunchtime rush. The trick is to phone your order in 10 minutes before you pick it up.
author: Allen T.

description:
Decent sandwich shop in an area that seems to just lack places to get lunch in general.  Legitimately tasty italian meats, bread was ok, and I would say to definitely add the pepper spread.

Will definitely go back and try other stuff but I ordered a small Italian Combo on soft sourdough with the works and pepper spread, which was plenty of food and only half the price of some of the other sandwich shops in the area.
author: Erin Q.

description: Freddie's sandwiches - hate to give away neighborhood secrets but they have old-style deli sandwiches at a very reasonable price.
author: Serena S.

description:
If it wasn't for my middle school, I would have never discovered this place!  Freddie's sandwiches is a hidden gem.  I went to Francisco Middle school ('98-'01 )which was across the street from this sandwich shop.  I used to come here in the morning with my middle school friends to purchase a student sandwich for $2.50 - $3.00.  Isn't that a steal for young kids?  I think it was the salami or the italian combo that I used to order but it was really delicious!  The student discount were only for students who were enrolled at the school at the time.  

What brought me to write this review was the sandwich I had earlier at Sourdough in San Jose.  The sandwich at Sourdough was amazing and instantly rang a bell in my head to remind me how much I miss Freddie's sandwiches.   Oh man, if only they had more amazing sandwich shops like Freddie's where I live now.  (I guess I have to discover them now!!) Till this day, I still go to Freddie's when I am home in SF.  Even my little sisters come here for their sandwiches, weekday or Saturday, didn't matter - that's how good the sandwiches are here! Prices here are fair and the sandwiches beat the price to it.
author: Lily M.

description: Good little sandwich shop in North Beach. I had a small turkey sandwich & a side of potato salad. The portions are generous, so I saved half the sandwich and potato salad for dinner. Two meal servings for less than $10? Score! The bread was super soft & delicious. I think I may try a hot sandwich next time. Also, very speedy & friendly service.
author: Kristen G.

description: This place is awesome!!!! Best sandwich I had in my life. At first we actually wanted to leave after seeing this place because of the  first impression we had entering. We would have never gotten a sandwich here if it wasn't for the good reviews. Try the pastrami & turkey sandwich! OMG!!!
author: Meike W.

description:
I used to go to the original location 2-3 times a week when I worked near Pier 39.  I was ecstatic to lean that Freddie's now has a SECOND LOCATION at Pine & Polk.

I'm normally not much of a sandwich person, but there is something about Freddie's that is so addicting.  Their soft sourdough is my bread of choice.  They also have really great spreads.  

Do yourself a favor and GO TO FREDDIE'S!
author: S. Y.

description: I grew up eating Freddie's sandwiches. I went to Francisco Middle school which was right next to Freddie's and i use to live near there. My friends and I would always. Honestly, in all my life no other sandwiches can taste as good as theirs. MUST TRY the Italian Combo with dutch bread. I always get that sandwich. I have tried their tuna. Thats good too.
author: Judy U.

description: My husband and I have lived in the neighborhood for more than 2 years .  We've walked by this place many times but never stopped in until today. 2 years of lost opportunities!  Our sandwiches were terrific.  My husband had the veggie on sourdough and I had a Black Forest ham/Swiss on wheat. The bread is really fresh.  We also included the hot and mild pepper spreads which were awesome.  We will be returning on a regular basis.
author: Grace K.

description: Soggy meat. Stale bread. Current owner has let things sliiiiide.
author: Brandon R.

description:
Bomb sandwiches.  They are a pretty good size, I eat a lot and will be full off of a small sandwich.  They carry my favorite, peppered turkey.  Also, if you are into spicy stuff, get their jalapeno spread.  It's pretty much jalapenos diced and then spread on the bread.  Bread suggestions: onion bread which is extremeley soft and tasty and the dutch crunch which has the perfect amount of sweetness.  The place carries a bunch of other items for the school across the street: candy, chips, sodas, etc all of which are over priced but thats what you get for convience.   

For those of you who are familiar with Molinari's and Ikes, supposedly the best sandwich shops, this place doesnt have the same quality of meat as Molinaris and definitely not the flair of Ikes.  But it gets the job done, and done right.  If you are near Freddies I suggest stopping in instead of making the trek to either of the other places.  As I live a block away, it's an easy decision for me.

One complaint is I wish they were open on Sundays.
author: Chris S.

description:
Maybe closer to a 3.5, but I'm still giving it a 3 star for now.

I work basically in the middle of tourist headquarters (right across from Alcatraz) and have a hard time finding decently priced to-go food. Freddie's is just a couple blocks away (though uphill :/) which makes it easy for me to try again.

The prices are in the $8-10 range which might sound pricey, but the sandwiches are HUGE. I'm secretly a fat kid and finished mine, but I definitely struggled towards the end.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Italian combo on soft sourdough is amazing, especially because it is only about 6 bucks. The ladies there are really nice and friendly too. Tiny deli so don't plan on going there for the ambiance.
author: Akhil C.

description:
Somewhat surprising to this former New Yorker, but a good deli is extremely hard to find in SF.  Maybe it's just the general lack of real delis that has me feeling this way, but I'm always happy to find a good spot for a sub, grinder, hoagie, or sammy (whatever your geographic persuasion might be).

TO that end, Freddie's Sandwiches does NOT dissapoint!  They have a great selection of breads and rolls, and a team of ladies who put together giant sandwiches made to order.  The regular sandwich is enough for me (and I like to eat), but I usually go for the large so I can save half and eat it later.

The meats are good, the veggies are good, the cheeses are good, and most importantly, the breads are super fresh! Just make sure to get there early lest they run out of that incredible Dutch Crunch!

If you like it spicy, make sure to ask for jalapeño spread.  It is the BOMB!

The only thing I dislike about this place is that it's closed on Sundays... Seriously Freddy, consider a partner or some part-time staff to open up on Sundays, I work all week whch leaves me only Saturdays to enjoy some of the best subs in SF!
author: Rafael M.

description: We live really close to this place and I am in LOVE with it. If you like tuna salad, get the ALBACORE tuna salad on sourdough with mustard and cheddar. SO GOOD! They don't put a ton of mayo in the tuna salad which is how I like it. The other sandwiches there are also really good, nothing fancy.
author: Claire b.

description: Strange.  I don't get it.  These reviews rave about the sandwiches here.  Finally got around to trying them for lunch today and it was thoroughly unremarkable.  It was not that it was unpalatable; but simply uninteresting, bland.  Really basic and blah.  We tried the turkey and the Italian combo.  Not so much bothered by the bland lunch as much as confused over the ratings.  Yelp usually is not off so drastically en masse, so I can't explain it.  But my lunch partner was equally unimpressed so it wasn't merely me.  Weird.
author: Liz K.

description:
Ordered: Roasted Turkey on honey oat roll Swiss cheese no mayo no onions. 

I thought the sandwich was okay. Nothing special but decent. The roasted turkey was really thinly sliced and piled high which is a definite plus in my eyes. I thought the sandwich was a little dry. I know I don't do mayo but there should be an alternative to the nasty creamy white substance. The service was great. They were nice and quick even at the lunch time rush. I would go back again because I work near fisherman's wharf and hate hate hate Pier 39 but I wouldn't drive across town for one.
author: Jen C.

description:
I live in the neighborhood, and have been stopping by regularly for a sandwich for about two years. 

First up, I have no idea what's going on with the setup here - everytime I go in, it's the dude in charge and a harem of women who are apparently required to be silent, because they don't utter a word while they put together the sandwiches.

It seems like a weird Sandwich Palace, where the guy runs it like the Sultan of Sandwich Spread and forces his slavegirls to put together tuna salad after ham-n-cheese after veggie sandwich. But, you can't argue with quality. While nothing is a mindblowing sandwich experience, they are solid, totally reliable sammies that I would be happy to eat in any lunch situation. 

Decent prices, the service is fast and they have a great selection of beverages and chips on-hand to accompany your sandwich. I end up going with the soft sourdough almost every time, but the Dutch is also solid. 

It probably would have garnered four stars, but it does get a lot of tweeny traffic from across the street, which of course Freddie's has nothing to do with or has any control over, but I am a vindictive a-hole who wields my Yelp stars like a careful ninja.
author: Drew H.

description: Freddy's BLT is AMAZING!!! Such a cool old school deli that's been around since 1926 (give or take, don't really remember) but this place is so damn good I totally recommend it. Grab a sandwich and walk up Francisco st to a beautiful view of the city.  This place is very 'San francisco'
author: Michael A.

description:
I eat here at least once a week; I've been here as much as 5 days in a row.

Your standard sandwich shop. Consistent. Sandwiches are solid across the board, no specialty sandwiches, so everything comes with the meat and your basic sandwich ingredients. Haven't really found anything I don't like, although the falafel needs a little work (bland).

My only real dislike is Freddie lets the kids from the school across the street cut to the front of the line. I guess it's so he can get them in and out of there as fast as possible, but if you're waiting in line during the busy lunch hour it could be a bit irritating.

It's my favorite sandwich shop in the AREA, so I wouldn't say to some out-of-towners, "You've GOT to try this sandwich shop over by the wharf, it's to die for." Not gonna happen.
author: Harold C.

description:
I've lived in the North Beach all of my life and Freddie's has been the sandwich institution. 

I usually go for the Salami and Ham, which is a great choice. But I also recently tried the Club Sandwich and it is single-handedly the best Club a sandwich I've ever had. 

Freddie's has some of the best Dutch crunch that and everyone knows it's the bread that makes the sandwich.

The people who work there are really nice and if you continue to show your face they remember you, which makes the experience a whole lot better!
author: Mario M.

description: Some of the best things in life are simple and very inexpensive.  This place is old school awesome.  Grab the Italian combo and head down to the water or up to Jack Early Park (since they don't have seating) and enjoy the simple pleasure of a Freddie's Sandwich.  The place runs limited hours so don't head over too late in the day!
author: Jim K.

description:
Dear Freddie:
I was thinking about you the other day and I realized how much I miss you.  My office moved to SoMa and my lunch options have not been the same.  I loved how I could order a 6" from you and be full for 2 meals for under $7. ( I know that I have a healthy appetite since every time I would go here I would always see construction workers order the same amount.  Let's face it those guys know a good sandwich when they eat one!)

Freddie is also one of the nicest guys ever.  I love the neighborhood feel and he always remembers me.
author: Sarah C.

description:
I tried the corn beef on dutch crunch here and I thought it was pretty good. The sandwiche didn't come anywhere near the taste of Ike's or Little Lucca's, but it is still very good.

They also have a good amount of drinks, candy, chips, etc here. Nice spot if you don't want to go into a liquor store to get this stuff. 

I noticed when walking in there for the first time, the man at the counter just gave off this Soup Nazi vibe. He seems like a nice guy, but he was pretty much all business when I was there. 

Stop by if you're in the area, but I don't feel like you need to go out of your way to come here.
author: John G.

description: there are 2 things a deli must have for me to give them my business: dutch crunch and shredded lettuce. freddies offers both and much, much more. it also happens to be 1.5 blocks from my house. lucky girl! honestly, their dutch is the BEST! super crunchy. i always call my (regular) order in and when i show up it's ready to go. i also appreciate that they cut and wrap halves individually in case you want to save some for later. they have everything figured out. a vast array of drink + chip selection and they take cards! salami+cheddar+revive vitamin water for $8 is my saturday hangover (or not) go to. the only thing that bums me out is that they're closed on sundays but hey, everything good deserves a day off.
author: Emily C.

description:
I went to Freddie's for the first time today and I agree with most of the yelpers - 3.5 stars.

 The sandwiches here are pretty solid. This place is not as crazy as Ike's or Little Lucas with the house-made garlic sauce, nor does it try to be. Freddie's still has a wide selection of fresh bread, including my favorite - Dutch Crunch, and the normal deli choices. The sandwich is huge; they don't skim out on the ingredients. I got a small albacore tuna sandwich (6") with avocado for $7.70 today and I was full eating just half of it, granted I'm a girl who doesn't eat THAT much. But still, it's still a pretty big sandwich.

Coworker got the club (ham, turkey, and bacon with avocado) toasted. She didn't like it as much as I did. They toasted the sandwich without her asking which she didn't mind. But it was a little too toasted which made the bread dry and the ham made it a bit too salty for her.

If you work near the Wharf and given the incredible lunch selection we have here, I'm pretty sure I'll come back here again.
author: Winnie A.

description: This eatery should be designated as a SF landmark.  It's been here since 1926 and been changed hands a few times.  The current proprietor has been here for more than a decade.  Its main clientele is the school across the street.  I hear that people who grew up in the neihgorhood and moved away still come back for their fixes.  I was curious enough and made the trek to this little corner store.  There's nothing fancy about this North Beach establishment and it does show its age.  I didn't seek out the traditional turkey or roast beef sandwich.  I went for the large Italian Combo ($8.50).  Although its a little pricer than Subway, but its a hundred times better.  Pound for pound, I think the amount of meat in it actually makes it a bargain and tastier than the $5 Subway.  I usually don't (or can't) consume a large sandwich at one sitting.  On this occasion, when I started, I couldn't stop and broke my own record.  This is not the best sandwich in the Bay Area, but its on my short list.
author: Jean T.

description: Have been going here for 45 years. We make special trips out of our way to get sandwiches. These are the best sandwiches anywhere!!!!!
author: John G.

description: Been coming here for a long time and i mean like for over 20 years. Place hasnt changed. Love the variety and the prices. Keep up the good work and im sorry bout that time when my son knocked over the bag of chips lol
author: Tareau B.

description:
good memories coming here for lunch when i worked in the area.

soaking up the sun on the bench outside, sandwich in hand, watching the kids play at recess at the school across the street, the very italian locals walking by.

the sandwiches are big and filling. definitely get the spicy sauce.

can get pretty busy at lunch time but the guy at the counter (freddie?) always remembers who ordered what.

simple, no fuss, no stress, easy, tasty sandwich shop.
author: Shawn C.

description:
This review stack is already filled with intimate details about how amazing the sandwiches are. So how about some random points...

- When me and my wife wanted to move, "Not being able to walk to Freddie's" was 3rd on our CON list.

- I think my friends visit me just so they can get Freddie's, and eat it outside on my porch.

- Craving something to put you in a food comma on Sunday? Want to taste something crafted by an immortal sandwich smith? Prepare for tears my friends. Freddie's is closed.

- I was in San Jose, starving and hungover.  I didn't eat till the afternoon before. Instead of grabbing something to eat down there. I drove all the way home, and walked from my car, straight into Freddie's.
author: Tom G.

description:
I'm pretty much just going to add to the rest of the amazing reviews about Freddie's.  I definitely love to read about those who use to come here during their middle school days at Francisco. My favorite memories and stories however, are those of my parents who both attended Francisco back in the 60s. And while they didn't know each other back in middle school, they both agree on this one simple fact: lunch at Freddies.  I'm glad to hear it has pretty much stayed the same over the years.  

I love their Italian Combo, on both Dutch Crunch and Soft Sourdough.  I always get the whole loaf to share and it's great that you can chose from a variety of different breads instead of getting the same one just because you ordered a whole loaf.  For the best deal, get a whole loaf and mix up the breads.  

Sandwiches are huge and Freddies is very generous with their meats, and sides like shredded lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, etc.  I love adding jalapenos to my sandwiches for that extra zing.  I also have this little weird quick about my sandwiches from Freddies...buying a bag of chips and putting them inside my sandwich. The crunch is a great addition to the sandwich in my weird opinion. Give it a try next time =D  

Simply said, Freddie's is one of the best local deli's in S.F. And for my family, it definitely goes 2 generations back;  Not quite that long, but I hope to have this local gem to be in business into the near future.
author: Cass J.

description: My boyfriend, his bestie and I came here to meet up with my bestie for lunch and spend the whole day to hang out in the Bay. After looking for a good lunch place, I came across lots of positive reviews from this place and figured, "Hey why not?" So we had lunch here outside the shop on some chairs. We all loved our sandwiches. It was yummy in our tummies! I got a roasted chicken breast with veggies, avocado, provolone cheese and whole wheat. Big portion, but satisfying and healthy at the same time. Made with fresh ingredients. Subway got nothin' on this place! Next tim I wanna try the vegetarian sandwich with hummus. Yum! I love the location too. How it is walking distance from Pier 39 and the surrounding cafes and restaurants. This area would make for some great photo taking (since I am an aspiring photographer/graphic designer and get lots of inspiration from SF)
author: Hannah P.

description:
i am currently in the midst of a serious, potentially fatal food coma.  experts are hopeful at my recovery, but not making any assertions just yet.  

the cause of this food coma was a SMALL sandwich from freddie's.  it was also vegetarian, so this isn't even meat induced.  instead i'm a victim of wolfing down a delicious soft sourdough sandwich, piled high with tomato, lettuce, cheese, pickles, cucumber, avocado, and myriad spreads of deliciousness. 

i've started to wiggle my toes and blink my eyes, so it looks like i'm going to pull through.  but now i know not to tempt fate like that again.
author: Rachel H.

description: Hands down one of the best sandwich spots in the city cant beat a full loaf Italian combo on their hard roll.
author: RYAN Y.

description:
Did I have lunch in the same place as the rest of you? 

My bf and I had been meaning to stop in here for a while and finally did for lunch today. The portion size was good, as we were able to share a large. The sandwich was fine, but certainly nothing to get excited about...

I'm able to identify low-quality meats when I see them (thanks to a past job...)  and I saw them at this place. And the bread was dry.I can get that from my local corner store. Oh, wait. My corner store has better quality meat than Freddie's.

The place is clean and well-kept, so I'd eat a Freddie's sandwich again if it were presented to me,  but I won't be back.
author: Sonj F.

description: Freddies is awesome! The italian combo on sourdough soft is where its at! Not only is the sandwich one of the best in sf, but the price is amazing. Only around 5 bucks, where else can you get that?
author: Marshall B.

description: Great sandwiches with quality ingredients. While they do take credit and debit cards, bring cash to expedite your order since it can get pretty busy around lunch time.
author: Will K.

description:
Friends of mine were at Freddie's and helped me pick up a sandwich from there. I never tried it before but it was delicious!! The bread was perfect and they piled my italian combo to the max! 

Will definitely be back!
author: M W.

description:
Great sandwiches!  Freddy's has become a Saturday ritual for me.  

Being this far north in North Beach (practically fisherman's wharf) leaves me aching for quality food.  Freddy's fills the gap!

A desperate wish of mine is that they catered more to vegetarians with some kind of veggie lunch meat even if it was something easy like Yves.  I also wish they had vegan mayo but hey, I can't get everything I want.  I also wish I could get my Freddy's on in the evening and on Sundays.  Either way, they still get 5 stars.
author: Jeff G.

description: Great sandwich shop for a quick lunch! Very old school, but super friendly staff and great bread selections.
author: Holly K.

description:
I came here during my obligatory tourist hours during family visits. They wanted to see North Beach and I picked this place to grab some lunch given its high praise here on Yelp.

My mother-in-law, who turns her nose up at "store bought food" praised this food. Praised it, like an evangelical praises the LAWD! I actually had some of hers to see if it was laced with drugs. Turns out it was laced with Scrumptious.

My BLT was great, although the bacon was not as crispy as I like it. That's a pretty small whine compared to the good parts. Service was great, the ingredients were fresh and delicious, bread was wonderful. Quaint little spot, even had a couple of chairs outside to sit and eat your sandwich on a nice day.

It does not beat Roxie, in my opinion, but it's up there.
author: Aaron C.

description:
Solid sandwich and the cure to my champagne hangover.
Crusty sourdough roll, herb/garlic spread, shredded lettuce and meat = the best thing ever on Saturday morning.
author: Kathleen E.

description:
Ah, there's nothing like grabbing a veggie sandwich between 12:30 - 1:30pm and watching the little middle school children play during their lunch break across the street...

 They're delicious and affordable (The sandwiches, that is...)
author: Scott G.

description:
ugh
i said no onions dude. no onions. they are my arch enemy!!!! 
don't fill my sandwich with onions. so pumped to try this place since it has such great reviews. threw it in the garbage right when i got home.
details are important.
author: Tiger Lily ..

description: So last week i was in the neighborhood and had no clue what to eat.  I searched yelp like i always do on my android phone and phone this sandwich shop with 4 1/2 stars.  I was starving and decided to give it a try.  Got lost a couple times cuz my Navi steered me wrong but finally found the place.  Its a small deli and i ordered the italian on soft sourdough cuz it had great reviews.  Waited to 5 mins and was ready to chomp away.  First impression was sandwich looked like any other ive had before.  Took a couple bites and thought it was alright.  Then
author: Hugh L.

description:
I'm on a sandwich kick.  After experiencing Ike's Place yesterday there is little that can satisfy me at this point in time outside of a damn good sandwich.

Freddie's is levels better than RJ's (in the same area) and about two to three dollars cheaper, too.  Definitely worth the small trek up those random ass steps from Embarcadero.  

Minus stars though because the "soft" sourdough tore up the roof of my mouth.
author: Jay H.

description:
This place is always busy and you'll know why when you eat one of their sandwiches. Huge ! Unless you are a total pig, be sure to only order the
small size. I am falafel lover and often opt for their tasty version - available in spicy or regular. Only open for lunch during weekdays. Definitely a take out spot - only a few seats available outside.
author: Kathleen D.

description: ok I admit that I am I guess a fan of this place due to nostalgia . when I was in 7th grade I use to come here and get ham and chesse on a sour roll and still do even though the chesse is not quite the same and the ham is not the same. got some gristle in the ham the last time humm....but I guess I would still come here. oh you can order extra meat and chesse it just cost you more like $25 for 2 large sandwiches.
author: Nellie J.

description:
Dear Freddie:

You can totally suck me. Print this out and put it in the window with your other reviews, please. I am your neighbor and a loyal sandwich buyer of 3+ years. You still don't recognize me. You still treat me like tourist trash. You still serve people that arrive 10 minutes after me first. You even let your (OUR) mailman give me the 'tude. I have been nothing but a supportive, friendly patron to you. 

I have a newsflash for you, Fred - your sandwiches are good, but they aren't good enough for you to treat people the way you have treated me for the past 3 years. We're through. Over. Done. Finito. I don't want your dutch crunch any more, pal. 

I can get my salami elsewhere.

Lovelessly,
Katelin

P.S. You knew it was coming, didn't you?
author: Katelin H.

description:
Fresh baked bread, friendly service, hellofa sandwi.

 I say that the sandwich is delicious and many concur. Come check it out. One of my favorite spots to get a sando in the city, and i have been to many
author: Jason S.

description:
I live a block away from here and I really do love this place.  I do have to disclose that this place have been here ever since I've lived here, so I am bias.   

The previous owner knew that I use to live around the neighborhood and would always give me a couple of slices of salami while I waited for my sandwich.  I was probably 7 back then and he would always look after me.  After making my sandwich and me paying of course........he would watch me while I walked back home.  I can see the sandwich store from where I live, so it was very comforting to turn around and see him waving at me.  This neighborhood use to be a little tough back then..........so you can probably guess how long ago this was.

Moments like this makes me remember how the little things in life are so important.  Anyway.........the business was then sold to one of  the workers( I love these types of stories).  The worker then took over this business and made it to what it is today.......  A great deli in the North Beach district that still keeps the integrity and culture of Freddie's sandwiches.  This sandwich is not toasted nor does it have any fancy dressing on it.  I order my sandwich freddies way. It's a soft sour, mayo, mustard, your choice of meat and that's it.  This is as simple and as good as it gets.

I use to go here for lunch when I went to middle school across the street.  They have a huge array of candies back then.  This use to be a place where you bought now and later, jolly ranchers, lemon heads, Alexander the grape..........all of those old school candies.  I just love how they preserve the interior of the shop and still looks and feels clean.  

It really is great to see a business in this neighborhood do well.
author: jason g.

description:
Great sandwiches.  Good selection of fillings.  Good service.

I live less than a block from here.  It sometimes takes them a while to make your sandwich so I recommend calling it in.

Enjoy.
author: Theron L.

description:
Whenever I walk by Freddie's, it's always surrounded by people who work and live in the neighborhood:  a local cop or two, the trash collector, North Beach residents, school kids from across the street, and people working in the offices nearby.  There's a reason why they keep coming back.  The menu variety, quality of meats and breads, customer service, and prices are top-notch.

Personally, I first came in for the sandwiches, but now I come back for the jalapeno spread (this stuff is delicious).
author: Andrea U.

description:
The reason this gets 4 stars is mostly because there is absolutely nothing else in the area that's even half-decent. A bad area to work, for sure.

The  dutch crunch rolls are great, the garlic spread is super-yummy and they have a good selection of both meats and gourmet potato chips. Other than that, it's a sandwich shop but in this area that's sadly enough.
author: Dan B.

description:
Solid sandwiches, especially for the North Beach area.

Cafe Capiriccio is very very good, but if you want a deli sandwich, you have to go to a deli-sandwich place-- this would be the place to go.  

I wasn't in the meat mood, so I was between the vegetarian (cheese, avocado, garlic spread, and the regular works) and the falafel vegetarian. I was in the "regular" sandwich mood, so I went with the vegetarian. Nice blend of flavors-- the oil and vinegar, crisp lettuce, garlic spread, and the very very good dutch crunch. 

I would've liked more avocado. It seemed to be just a small layer within the thick sandwich, but avocado in a vegetarian sandwich is usually what I consider to be the main ingredient. Good size for a dutch crunch though. (Small was $5.95) I've been to too many places where the dutch crunch is a small roll and you feel cheated.

My boyfriend had their honey turkey and was jealous that this deli is close to my work, not his :)

Will be coming back sometime in the future and trying their Mediterranean vegetarian sandwich. :)

2 benches and a few chairs are outside of this store. The store has a very small, local feel. The owners (i think) were very friendly and conversing with the regulars. Good collection of Kettle chips (though they were out of the Spicy Thai flavor!!! my fav!)
author: Saori E.

description:
When you order your sandwich at Freddie's, you get your choice of meat, bread, and condiments, and it's all put together by a fast and friendly staff.  These are sandwiches for people who like sandwiches.  These are not finger sandwiches for wine and cheese soirees.  You get something tasty and substantial.

Freddie's can sometimes get quite crowded at peak lunch hours, so if you don't want to wait in line, go early or wait until the lunch rush is over.

There's one small bench outside of Freddie's, but there's always places in the neighborhood to enjoy your sandwich, like Jack Early Park (really just a staircase with a small platform up top and a great view), and a bunch of green space down the stairs towards the flat part of Francisco.

A couple times I stopped back to check on the neighborhood for a bit of dot-com nostalgia.

That expensive office building on Francisco that I used to work in has been unoccupied since October  2001, but that's not important to me.

The important thing is that Freddie's Sandwiches is still there.  Cheers to that! :)
author: Justin C.

description:
Are you kidding me about this friggin place? I mean to say that Freddy's has the best sandwiches in North Beach if not North America would be a disservice, because I literally have dreams about swimming in a country pond of their chicken salad with only pepperocinis covering my dijon-smeared loins.
I cry out at night for dutch crunch, and hot coppa.  Stare out the window at work for hours enraptured with the thought of curling myself about a large toasted Italian combo with everything, yes give me everything, with jalepeno spread, so that i may relive that first time I made gastronomical love my first Freddy's sub....oh Lord. give me Freddy's or give me death.
author: zach o.

description:
THE BEST SANDWICHES IN SAN FRANCISCO!

no lie, I would recommend this deli to anyone; including you, you and YOU! I've been a loyal customer for 10 years, not kidding! It doesn't matter what sandwich you order, it'll just be super tasty, and super filling. The prices are fair and there are sooo many selections to choose from.

Always fresh and always good! I SWEAR BY THIS SANDWICH JOINT!
author: Alex C.

description:
Ok, this place is right around the corner from where I work and everyone raves about it, so I thought it was time to give it a whirl.

Freddie's offers many different sandwiches, breads, hot, toasty, sizes, you name it, it's an option.  A small sandwich is $5.75, not too bad for a decent lunch.  I didn't have to wait very long, which is a plus.  It certainly tasted awesome.  After half of my sandwich I was full as well, a small is certainly filling.  This is a cash only place.  There is an ATM inside, but I hear it charges you a $3 fee.  You've been warned.

I have to knock off a star  though for who I assume is "Freddie".  I was half expecting him to say "NO SANDWICH FOR YOU!"  Dude is the sandwich nazi, I swear.  I mean really, would it kill you to be cordial?  People are flocking to you and throwing you their money.  Surely that has to make you somewhat happy!

I'm sure I'll go back since it's so close, but really, buck up tiger.  Too many bad attitude experiences will make even me run away, and I can tolerate it all.
author: Jen K.

description:
I had the vegetarian sandwich on sour sourdough roll which came with: tomatoes, shredded lettuce, cucumbers, tomatoe, cheese, mushed avocado, oil and vinegar, pickles, pesto spread, mustard and mayonnaise.   

Its $5 for a (large) small.  $6.50 for a (huge) large.  This is how much a sandwich should cost. 

And, they had every flavor (big and small sizes) of Kettle Chips and all flavors of Vitamin Water.

Its by the Francisco middle school.  That should help you find it easily.
author: Wakako U.

description: Eddy is awesome...never makes me feel bad about my occasionally complex order. Plus, the green onion bread? Holy cow...best thing EVER! It made me soo happy.
author: Leslie T.

description:
As far as traditional West Coast style "in and out" deli's go, this place takes the cake. The quality of ingredients, the meat they use, the special spreads, multiple breads, its a no brainer. I am currently sitting next to a gorgeous large hot corned beef on hard sour roll with pepper and garlic spread, tomatoes, onions, pepper jack cheese, and love that only a latin mother could add (and yes this is a primarily latin run restaurant). They do hot and cold, ciabata bread, falafels, and yes they have beer and a host of other drinks.

If you are a sandwich connoisseur go get your favorite combo here and prepare to have your mouth made sweet love to, and your flavor buds stimulated intensely.
author: Zack D.

description:
My friend - self proclaimed yelp master - took us here when we were up here for beer fest. Tired, starving & hung over we trekked over from the Sheraton anticipating yummy deli sandwiches. Fifteen minutes and several steep hills later, we were greeted by a giant closed sign.

Yup - they're closed on Sundays. thanks jonathong =P
author: Flora V.

description:
I decided to check out Freddie's based on the strength and number of its Yelp reviews, but I was sorely disappointed. My first test for any sandwich shop is my favorite sandwich: roast beef and provolone on sourdough with everything except onions. Service was quick and friendly, most of the people there for lunch seemed to be regulars and familiar with the staff, prices were good and there's a good selection of chips and drinks. 

However, I really didn't like my sandwich. The lettuce was shredded too finely so its texture was more like that of sprouts, it and the tomato were very watery, making the mayo, mustard and my bread watery, and generally washing out the flavor that should have been there. The saddest thing was the state of the roast beef, which seemed more like something you'd buy processed and pre-packaged than fresh from a deli. It didn't have good flavor and the color didn't seem like a medium rare roast beef, but some kind of unnaturally uniform fake coloring.

Perhaps I should go back and try one of the sandwiches some of the other reviewers recommend, but my first experience failed to inspire my confidence. I'll keep you posted.
author: Kristina A.

description:
Anyone on the search for a solid sandwich on fresh, fresh bread - you have found it.

Couple of things to know - the line at lunch gets long (they are fast but they are also very popular) and you can fax in your order ahead of time, saving yourself the previously mentioned line.  My office often gets these huge "Freddie's Runs" going where we fax in a numbered list.  I think we've had one sandwich mix up the entire time.

Also, for the Freddie's virgins - if the bread you order is one of the rolls or the dutch crunch bread it leads to BIG sandwiches.  Share with a friend.
author: Suzanne B.

description:
A tasty little sandwich shop, located off Powell and Francisco. Typically priced sandwiches, but tasty and you're guaranteed to have leftovers for later. 

During the weekdays, this place can be packed with students, as right across the street from the sandwich shop is a local middle school. Their selection of breads are awesome: I love their Dutch bread! Crunchy! Their french bread rolls are pretty good, too. I think my favorite was the Italian combo, which came with Italian sausage and other meats. 

The prices aren't that bad. You typically will walk out spending about $5-$7. If you're lucky, that price will include a bottled beverage. 

If you're in the area, try out Freddie's. Good sandwich yum!
author: Melinda L.

description: I've grown up eating to-go sandwiches from Freddie's as my parents started coming here when they were young.  It's a neighborhood sandwich landmark.  My usual order: Small/ Large Italian combo w/ mayo & mustard on the soft sourdough roll.  Parking can be tough, but you may luck out and snag a spot in their green zone.
author: Stacey L.

description:
I don't remember the sandwiches being this bad.  I've been coming here since I was a kid and I realize that the ownership has passed through at least two owners.

There used to be limited choices; italian combo on soft sourdough.  I haven't had anything off of the new menu, but the attempt at the old italian combo misses its mark; the soft sourdough seemed like they forgot to bake the bread and the deli meat was tasteless.

I guess you should go, if you don't have any prior experience with this as a North Beach institution.
author: Collin W.

description:
Good sandwiches at a decent price - with a very good selection of candies, chips and beverages.

Cold cuts really aren't my thing, so I probably rank sandwich shops lower than say, Joey Tribiani.

I really like how they use a jalapeño spread - gives me a consistent flavor throughout.
author: Greg H.

description:
I agree with most of what has been said about Freddie's below.
They are fast, the portions are big, the price is good. But this is San Francisco, not Topeka. We expect more from our sandwiches than speed and portion size.
The ingredient quality is pretty average. Plain processed cheeses, very simple meats, boring bread-- by no means anything special. 
So if I were in the neighborhood and I was starving, it's totally passable, but certainly nothing to go out of the way for.
author: Eli A.

description:
It's just so damn good.  And they do it over and again every single day.

The Italian combo on soft sourdough with garlic spread.  Wash it down with a little vitamin water.  How on earth would anyone pay through the teeth at the nearby Safeway deli for a rotten sandwich when Freddie's is so close and so good!

It is the favored lunch place for my coworkers.  We usually call our orders in and come in to pick up.  It saves having to wait in line during rush.  They would get five stars but one of the chicks behind the counter had an issue with my weight one day.  Welcome to San Francisco where a good deal of the population understand more than one language, biatch!

Besides, it is your sandwiches that made me fat.  All your fault, I should get a discount.
author: Cheezy P.

description:
Over the past two years, I have tried valiantly to like this place.  It is literally right around the corner from where I live, and it seems like it could be such a charming neighborhood sandwich shop. 

Disappointment.  The sandwiches are not terrible--think Safeway deli quality.  However, Freddie's consistently sour and unfriendly demeanor (aside from a select few who are evidently in his good graces) killed what little desire I still had to pay $8 for a mediocre deli sandwich. 

So much for the convenient location.  I'd much rather wander up the hill to Palermo, Giordano Brothers or Petite Deli for exceptional sandwiches (at reasonable prices) and warm, friendly service.
author: Katy D.

description:
Thank goodness for Yelp! Every time my boyfriend and I would go to the city for lunch, he would mention this particular sandwich shop he and is friend Ryan had run into once years ago. He mentioned how good it was and how they have various spreads. The only problem was that since it was years ago, he could not remember the name or the area that the sandwich shop was in. Lucky for him, I Yelp more than he does and was determined to find the place he kept raving about. I love me a good sandwich! I typed in "sandwich with spreads" and WALA, showed him a pic to see if it was the place he talked about and we went for lunch yesterday. :)

Lemme tell ya, this place was absolutely AMAZING. The sandwiches here are definitely out of this world! I got a small peppered turkey on sourdough sliced, no mayo, everything else on it, pepper jack cheese and jalapeño spread. SO DELICIOUS...I savored every bite and didn't leave a single crumb! 

You can't eat inside, but no biggie. There are benches outside and chairs w/some small tables. I went around 1pm yesterday and this place was still poppin'. The staff here are friendly too. Even though this place gets busy, they don't take long to make a sandwich. They also have a good selection of drinks and chips. I will definitely be coming here to get my sandwich fix when I'm in the city!
author: Veronica L.

description:
If I am ever to move away from San Francisco, Freddie's is hands down the one thing I will miss most.

Thank goodness I only live 2 blocks away and go there every Saturday.

If you don't get the (hard) sourdough roll you don't know what you're missing!  I give people the glare (yes that was me) when they order sliced wheat or something... blech!  as if!

I love you more than life itself Freddies!!!
author: Derek B.

description:
After twenty minutes inside, my boy and I sat on a bench outside and ate some of the most delicious sandwiches.  He even compared it to his beloved Marina Submarine--a major compliment, coming from him.

I love the soft sourdough.  Yum!

I work on Francisco Street now, so this could get dangerous!
author: Melissa Q.

description:
I had almost forgotten about this spot.  I used to come for these great sandwiches here about a year ago but it wasn't until a recent work visit to the area brought me back to these fantastic subs. I can't tell you how good these are...

Tips?

Whatever you do... get it grilled... or pressed... or whatever they do to make it all hot and delicious.
author: Thadd L.

description:
Hands down one of the best Sandwich places in the city! Fresh ingredients and their soft sourdough works well with almost any sandwich. The italian combo packed with meaty goodness topped with jalapeno  sauce is one of my fav's, along with a hot roast beef sandwich with swiss cheese, pasto-mayo are delicious! 
Too bad they stopped selling
author: Ruth R.

description:
I don't know what I love more:
The fact that I only have to take my fat ass up one block to get there OR
The fact that they make such awesome fresh sandwiches,,,,
ok, ok, its the great sandwiches. I am obsessed with their dutch crunch...so yummy. The best part about this place is you can call ahead and cut all the dumb asses who didn't know any better...okay so I'm a mean person, and I like to be served first- sue me! ANyway, the one draw back- be prepared to pay a little more for your sandwich...I'm only mildly exaggerating when I say its like $9 for a sandwich and a drink. WORTH EVERY PENNY I SAY!!

PS They lost a point because EVERY time I go there they mess up my boyfriends sandwich...I guess they just don't luv him as much as they luv me...
author: Jess W.

description: FYI...I am eating an Italian combo from Freddie's as I am writing this review, so this review could sway with each bite. We moved to North Beach 6 months ago and have always walked past this little corner spot on our afternoon walks. Today we took the plunge and got the Italian combo on a sweet dutch roll. The small was 5.95 and it is enough to feed me and my girlfriend. The sweet dutch bread is... well, sweet and has a nice texture to it. They are extremely generous with their meat, and I will surely take a nap after eating just half of the sandwich. The guy that took our order was very friendly, and looks like he could be the head of an "Italian Family", if you know what I mean.
