Yep, my Italian stereotyping will probably get me shot one of these days, but if I do go I wouldn't mind making Freddie's Italian combo sandwich my last meal.
author: Incognito S.

description: I went to Freddie's Sandwiches due to reading their Yelp page. It seemed that they were destined to be a great place but unfortunately, i may have had my hopes too high. I ordered the club, and the bread wasn't fresh and was really tough to eat. I'm sure that when their bread is fresh they are a great place, but in doesn't compare anywhere near California Sourdough in the South Bay. That place remains my spot for a go-to sandwich in the bay.
author: Carlos G.

description: This is a pretty nice sandwich shop. It is right next to my current school (please don't stalk me) and all the kids go here right after school and before. The guy gives all students a discount for 3 dollars a sandwich, which is a very good deal. They have a huge drink selection that doesn't seem to overpriced. The sandwiches do have pretty good quality, but remember to get like a bag of chips or something along with the sandwich because sometimes it takes up to 15 minutes just to get the order done.
author: Jeffy Y.

description:
I dream about this place. Seriously.  The hard sourdough rolls?  Yeah, they are full of noble glory.  The fresh turkey or salame?  Are you kidding?  Pure golden tastiness.  I can't even finish this review because I have to go run up the Francisco Street stairs and grab a friggin' sandwich already.  I don't run up stairs, unless there is a Freddie's sandwich at the top of them.

P.S.  Scroll down to Zach O.'s review.  Trust this guy, he's the biggest sandwich enthusiast you will ever meet.  Seriously, he writes blog posts about them.
author: Sarah H.

description:
Price gouging at the corner of Stockton and Francisco.

For anyone with money to waste, I highly recommend you order a large BLT on sliced sourdough. For the paltry sum of $8, you too can proudly own a sandwich that you can read a newspaper through.

I kid you not folks, this sandwich was, in the aggregate, no larger in length, width or height than your standard PB&J and had MAYBE 3 pieces of bacon on it... for $8 #%@ing dollars. There is absolutely nothing special about this sandwich shop. Do yourself a favor and take the short walk to Palermo's or Giordano Brothers.

What a joke.
author: Colin R.

description: I enjoyed my Italian Combo.  The large was $6 out the door and really big.  Probably a small is big enough for most.  Nice help and good selections of meats.  Sourdough roll was very good, but a little hard.  Probably would go soft roll next time.
author: Marc S.

description: As far as sandwiches go, I must say it's not even worth trying.  Come on, pile on the meat instead of piling on the tomatoes & lettuce which made my sandwich super soggy!  I drove clear across town for this sandwich & was totally disappointed.  I will not be back!!!
author: G W.

description: The worst thing about freddie's is it is closed the sundays. It always seems like I am driving by and hungry when it is closed. Yeah, so the customer service isn't the best, but the quality sub makes up for it. The are the best when toasted...also w/ oil & vinegar, pepperoncinis and garlic spread.
author: pablo e.

description: If only they were also open on Sunday! Best sandwiches I've found around the Bay/Stockton streets of North Beach.
author: Colin G.

description:
Saturday is my favorite day of the week because, among other reasons, I get to go to Freddie's.  I should take off a star because they are closed on Sundays, but who cares this little shop is so bomb it has become my favorite sandwich place in the city.  

The soft roll is superb, the dutch crunch is delicious, and the hard sourdough makes a damn tasty lunch.   I have had cold sandwiches, hot sandwiches, big ones, and small ones, they all fail to disappoint.  Currently though, I cannot get enough of the combo, on the soft roll.  I don't even need to get a large because the small size is the perfect meal.

Oh, and to the reviewer below....Eddie (the current owner of the store)  doesn't like everybody.  You have to grow on him, kinda like the Soup Nazi, but that is what makes this place so unique.  A true Mom and Pop joint where the quality of the sandwiches comes first.
author: Korey A.

description:
Cheap and delicious.  This place is a North Beach institution.

My favorite - italian combo on dutch crunch with jalapeno spread (hold the mayo).  The small size is about $6 and feeds me for 2 meals.
author: Alyssa W.

description: Order the Italian on toasted soft sour dough. Great portions and good  people.Many types of bread to choose from. Everything is pretty basic. They don't heat up sandwiches and the salads are decent. But they know how to do what they do. They make a great sandwich for about 8 bucks. Nice job Freddies!
author: Edward N.

description:
This place is the bomb for a reasonably priced sandwich.
Whatever you get, get it on Dutch Crunch, delish!
author: Shawn P.

description: Fcuk balls! I lived in this neighborhood for a decent amount of my life and I just found out about this place. I have been seriously missing out. Apparently they have been there for decades and have perfected their craft in sandwich making.
author: Jerry H.

description:
I had a day trip up to SF for work and made a bee-line for Freddies for lunch...  Best sandwiches when I lived in SF and I must say they did not disappoint when I had the priviledge to go yesterday. 

 Sandwiches were just as I remembered...

Why is it that you can not get hard sourdough rolls at ANY sandwich shop in LA???  I just don't get it.

Veggie sandwich is the best - WITH jalapenos...yum...
author: Jennifer S.

description:
YUM

Anyone who is from the east coast or is an east coaster at heart will love these sandwiches. I have no way to describe why they are so good or why they seem so east coast to me, but they just are. Something about the way they perfectly layer ingredients maybe? Either way, this is a damn good sandwich.

A little hard to get to for a person with no car - this definitely is not on my way to anything either. Going to have to make special trips for this one.
author: Sarah P.

description:
Great neighborhood sandwich spot.  I'm addicted to their Italian combo on an onion roll.  They've got a huge selection of different breads, ranging from soft and chewy to break your teeth hard (I guess some people are into that).  I rock the softer breads as I hate when I get a hard roll and take one bite only to have all of the filling slide out of the sanwich.  Do you know what I'm talking about, or am I the only weirdo that this happens to?  Anybody?  Bueller?

Anyway, great sandwiches for a reasonable price.  I don't know what the people bitching about $8 sandwiches are ordering.  My order usually is around $5.  Granted, I get the small, but that's plenty to fill me up.....and I've got a pretty good size appetite.  Next time you're in the 'hood and looking for a good sandwich, look no further than Freddie's.
author: Norm U.

description:
I like Freddie's sandwiches the way Freddy intended:

deli meat, provolone, mayo, mustard on a soft roll. period. 

Old San Franciscans eat it this way, and I don't see how decades of eating it this way could be anything but perfect.
author: Lauren C.

description: Never really had anything but the Italian Sub. and I have to say, after having that, no other place compares. Best sandwich I've had and when I'm in the city I almost go here and get one. Good portions, pretty pricey sometimes but they give you what you're paying for. People are nice when I go in. Only thing that sucks is if you don't have someone to go run in for you, parking can be problematic.
author: Michael Q.

description:
Let's see... a sandwich is a sandwich... unless of course it's a Freddie's sandwich.

This place is sooo good. I always have the same order: small italian combo on sweet dutch bread with jalapeo spread. Its worth every penny of the 5 bucks I pay . 

The drink options are impressive as well. They sell all types of sodas, juices, milk, beer etc. 

They have some lawn furniture outside for your convenience.
author: Lucy M.

description:
Hmmmm... closed on Sundays..... So yeah I get it, you want to have a day each weekend to close up your business to relax, but for the love of god, WHY can't you just move your weekend to Monday and Tuesday (and take two days off?) instead of trying to be like everyone else and having a weekend on Saturday and Sunday?  Some of us have a real job Freddie and can't make it to the corner of Francisco and Stockton during the week for lunch, so you only give me one day, ONE DAY, to have your sandwiches each week.  This means I have to plan my ENTIRE Saturday around you... well at least the part where I wake up, call in my order, walk a block and a half to pick it up, and come back home and eat it....  and I don't appreciate that.

What I DO appreciate though is your Club sandwich on soft sourdough (get the bread toasted people) with your deeeeeeeeeeeelicious garlic spread.  And you gotta love the bo-de-ga type setup in there with possibly San Francisco's largest selection of chips and drinks per sq. ft...  

(fyi, don't get a large, it's freaking LARGE, stick with the small and you'll be full for a few hours.)
author: Niall H.

description:
Another good hit on the saturday sandwich hunt. Great for italian meats and a really substantial sandwich. Not only did I save half my sandwich for later, but so did my extra large never quite full dining companion. 

I had a simple salami sandwich.  It was quite tasty. I had a few bites of an italian combo. I'd go back. I'll write more when I do.
author: Margie L.

description:
Ever since I moved to the neighborhood, I try to make it to Freddie's every Saturday. That's the only day I'm around when they're open. But it's worth it devote my Saturday lunch to this place. The prices are decent. My favorite so far is the italian. The meats and veggies are cut on site, and apparently the tuna and chicken salads are homemade and good. But this isn't what makes the sandwich. It's the bread. And anything on the dutch crunch is perfect. 

How famous is this place around where I live? I was walking back with a sandwich in the ubiquitious brown paper bag. I stopped at a light and a guy and a dog walked up to corner. The dog starts sniffing at the bag. The guy says sorry and pulls the dog back a little. I tell him it's ok, the dog just wants some of my sandwich. The guy looks at the bag and says, "Is that a Freddie's sandwich?" I tell him it is. He tells me he's been thinking about getting one all day and how he was just on his way home to drop off the dog and then run over to Freddie's.
author: The Sock S.

description:
The highlights: decent sandwiches and the wait time isn't atrocious.

The cons: I don't find the owner, or the man behind the counter, very friendly. He's gone so far as to nearly "throw" money at me. I've gone back many times as this place is close to my place of employment but his attitude has not improved at all. I even regret tipping *every* time I go. I don't think I'll go back...

I give the sandwich a 3/5 and the attitude 1/5.
author: DeLune Avec DeBussy B.

description:
I was first turned onto Freddies when I worked over the stairs on Telegraph Hill. It was here that I learned of the 'dutch crunch' roll, and the first thing I had them make me was a variation on a sandwich I used to get at the Hello Deli in NY: roast beef, jack cheese, cole slaw, brown mustard. 

While it wasn't the same as Rupert's, it was still the best sandwich in the area and it has me going back!
author: Joe R.

description: The guy at the counter had a little attitude problem. But whateves. I didn't like the sandwich- I got the italian combo. I think it's just not the copocolla from City Subs in Brooklyn (see my reviews) that I love so much. My mom said it was the best sandwich she had ever had and finished off my half. She was in a food induced coma/high and had some trouble biking down from Coit tower where we ate it. If you want a cold sandwich this is probably a good spot.
author: Lindsey J.

description: Great sandwiches.  Take-out only place.  Not sure why the sandwiches are so good, must be the hard roll bread cuz it's just cold meat and yellow mustard.  Always a treat to get a sandwich here.
author: Larry G.

description: I love Freddie's!! I have been going here ever since I learned how to walk!  Well, you get the picture.  Italian combo on hard sourdough -- it never gets old. I used to get the soft sourdough when I was a kid, but then ever since I tried the hard sourdough, the sandwich took on a whole new yum factor.  It tasted like a completely different sandwich, meaning just more addicting!  Never went back to the soft.  Martinelli's apple juice is also good for washing down the saltiness of the meat (you got your sweet and salty), but don't get me wrong, salty is what makes the sandwich so good!
author: Stacey L.

description:
Yelp.  My buddy.  This is my neighborhood sandwich joint.  I feel like you are now infringing on my space.  Step off.

Freddie's already can take a while.  But it is worth it.  That said, Freddies deserves the love it gets.  Damn good sandwiches, cheap.  The Italian Combo is amazing.  I love the hard roll, but it is hard and can tear up your mouth a bit (kinda like the second bowl of Capt'n Crunch), so if you aren't ready for that, get the soft sourdough roll.  Anyway, the egg salad and turkey are great too.  Meanwhile, the small is big enough for any person.  The large (6 bucks) is big enough for most couples to split.  

The one complaint and the only reason I am going to bump it down to 4 stars...it is not open on Sundays.  Since I work downtown, that means I only get my Freddie's fix on Saturdays...very sad.
author: Zac A.

description:
Absolutely delicious Italian sandwiches...I crave these at least once a week. Get the Dutch crunch bread, which has a thin layer of sweet crispiness at the top, and the jalapeno spread, which has a tangy, spicy kick, and your sandwich will be anything but ordinary.

I ate half of my sandwich the day we got them, and saved the other half for the plane ride home (refrigerated, of course). It was just as delicious -- if not better -- the next day.
author: Eeeeestar T.

description:
Small hot pastrami on soft sourdough with all the fixins - add provolone and pepperoncini spread. That's a little slice of heaven. I'm fully bummed that I just quit my job near Freddie's cause it's not likely that I'll end up back in this area for awhile. 
Dude - how are people rating this lower than 4 stars. Based on personality of the dude behind the counter?? Try talking to the dude. He likes you and I'm sorry that you're so sensitive.
author: Mike M.

description: OK, i have been here 5 times in the last 4 months and have always been very please with their great sandwiches. The bread is from Boudins of San Francisco just like the old Parisian Sourdoughs!! The large size is big enough to split with someone else, on second though, save it for later as you will eat it anyway!! I have the salami with american cheese (my all time favorite) with all the trimmings. I thinks this place been here for ever, as my oldest brother came here in the early 1960's after school across the street!! For the same sandwich in the 1960's , it cost a mere 25 cents, bag of of Granny Goose BBQ chips 15 cent.
author: Wolfy W.

description:
I've loved these sandwiches for decades,
For the value, freshness, bread.
Expect no frills
author: delbert t.

description:
I often wonder what good tastes like? Is it sweet, salty, uplifting, or fresh? Would a doctor or a priest know the difference if given the opportunity to define? 
I then have a Freddie's Sandwich and realize that it was stupid wander into such abstract corrals. Really good tastes like a loaded gun that has been fired at you. You just sit back and enjoy the caloric wanderlust blast into your stomach.
For your first time at this place, I recommend the pastrami, fully loaded, and on a very empty stomach. This sandwich alone will give keep you full for hours. If you decide to go large and eat it all in one serving, be warned! You will need to have a Siesta for ages.

It will be worth it.
author: Mario G.

description: Alright ...are you tiered of all those other sandwich shops,,,,,, Well have i got a place for you to try it's called FREDDIE'S and it in lower north beach , my family has been going there since 1926 and i still go there once a week . The place looks like it did back in the twenty's and the sandwiches haven't changed since i was a kid if you want a bomb ass sandwich my to favorite are the Italian combo on soft sourdough and the chicken salad on soft sourdough , no matter what you order its gonna be good. So the next time your in the mood for the best sandwich you have ever had just think Freddie's......................you wont be disappointed i promise. if you need to no were there at just Google them..........
author: Jeff P.

description:
How convenient, for sandwiches. 

Like anything custom made, the only complaint you can make, is why you didn't order more. You asked for it, and you got it. 

This place gets busy as hell, and you come here JUST for the sandwiches. Fast paced, and a great Family run business. 

Don't expect anywhere to eat inside. It's mostly a buy & run kind of place. You can always take the bench outside though. That was my usual spot after class, at the Academy. Which is conveniently located, right down the street. Parking here is good too, if you get here early enough, or when faculty leave the school. 

Even on google Street view, you can see some guy, with a sandwich in his hand, and you KNOW it's from Freddie's!!!
author: Charles K.

description:
I really don't go to Freddie's enough, considering I work nearby and the food options in this area is so limited.  I am not even a sandwich fan, but with Freddie's, I would always find myself craving it right around lunch time.  It's amazing how good a sandwich can get considering I can easily get the same ingredients from a super market.

I usually get either Veggie on wheat with jalepeno spread or Chicken Salad on soft dough with pepper jack.  Both are fresh, clean, with a nice spicy kick.  Perfect for a nice sunny day, absolutely love it!  

Their sandwiches are HUGE, I usually get a small, and it would still give me 2 meals.  The lines can get long around lunchtime, but they take phone orders.  They also have an assortment of drinks and chips including vitamin water and Miss Vickie's.
author: Christina D.

description:
Great prices for the large portions, delicious, freshly made and the jalapeno spread is amazing!  Plus it's close to my work when there's not much else to choose from.  The wait is generally pretty long during the normal lunch hours, but well worth it. There's a large selection of drinks ranging from Red bull SHOTS to snapples, to cokes, and Kettle Chips, plus lots of candy choices. MmM chocolate. 

the shop is tiny, with little seating outdoors, so you may want to take your lunch elsewhere to enjoy.
author: Lulu C.

description: I haven't had Freddie's Sandwiches in more than 13 years since I went to Francisco Middle School. My friend just told me about your second location it's just 3 blocks away I'm hoping to past by when I have time and have my favorite Turkey Sandwich on Dutch Crunch.. Talking about it makes me flashback from back in the days.
author: RICHARD W.

description:
time to get down and dirty about this sandwich shop and big thank you to my 14 yrs old niece to suggest these yummies en route to her school (best time to come 7:45am NO LINE-UP, baby!!!). I will explain why they received a 4 star instead of 5 star, so hold your panties :P

If STUDENTS - 6" (cut in half) is only $3 with limited selection. 

Italian combo (student) $3 served on a "toasted SOFT sourdough" (picture a huge long ass Artisan FRENCH BREAD then cut into pieces) - you get 1 layer (4 slices) of Salami and 4 layers of Ham with lettuce, tomato, Cheddar & JALAPENO spread.....YUM even though I'm not a huge fan of PLAIN ham :) Can't complain when is only $3 -  TWO 3" WARM bundles of joy on the palm of your hands waiting to ingest :)

Ham & Turkey again $3 - same type of bread as the above with mustard, mayo, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles & onions.  Didn't care for it as much since the first bite there was a HUGE turkey gamy smell. Tip: reheat in the toaster oven and the smell of the turkey will dissipate to make it more edible :)

Now here's my regular ADULT price sandwich $6.95 - Mortadella & Hot Coppa served on the same bread as above - 4 layers of Mortadella, 4 layers of Hot Coppa (they FORGOT to remove the NON-EDIBLE CASING on every slice, so how can you possibly expect me to give them 5 stars!!!) lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, onions, jalapeno spread with MOZZARELLA Cheese (highly recommend) - MY CREATION was YUM YUM YUM YUM YUM after removing all the casing myself; definitely taste the hot spice from the Coppa & Jalapeno spread (not suitable for kids / peeps that cannot handle their spice :P) heheeeee....just sayin'
author: Katy N.

description:
Another lunchtime standard for me, as I work just a few blocks away. 

A co-worker kept coming back from lunch every day with these amazing, huge, fragrant sandwiches, and we kept trying to pry out of him just where it was he was going every day. 

Finally we figured out his secret:  Freddie's.

This is real old-school neighborhood deli, where the meat and cheese are laid on thick and half a sandwich is a full meal -- very unlike the big-chain sandwich shops, where you get two or three paper-thin slices of meat and an inch-thick wad of lettuce.

Oh, and time your arrival carefully.  There's often a line out the door by 12:30 -- but I understand it's possible to phone ahead.
author: star s.

description:
When i hear Freddie's sandwiches, i can't help but just smile.
I've only had the italian combo - and that alone keeps me coming back.  Not to mention the friendly service and consistency.  
and at $5 for a small which is considered a large in most sandwich places - DEAL!!!  

THANK YOU FREDDIE'S!!!!
author: M E.

description: A damn good sandwich. Know what you want before you step up though. The dude at the register comes across as a sandwich nazi. I forgot about Dutch crunch bread...why don't they have that in LA anywhere?
author: Scott M.

description: HUGE hearty sandwiches that are to die for. I'm a sandwich fiend and they really don't get much better than this.  I'm a sucker for a good pastrami sandwich and they knock it out of the park here so to be honest I haven't even tried anything else.  I love the hard sourdough and wide variety of chips and sodas he sells out of his little tienda... BBQ Pop Chips, an RC Cola and a Pastrami Sandwich add up to amazingness.
author: Chris C.

description:
Really miss this sandwich shop. I was lucky enough to work by it for 4 years. Reasonably priced, tasty place. The small sized sandwiches were filing. I liked the Italina combo and the chicken salad. Dutch crunch and soft sour were good as were all the breads.

I would make a special trip to go here for lunch - Mama's girl for breakfast and then Freddie's for lunch.
author: joe m.

description: The sandwiches are a carlorific mouthful of love that keeps people like Jenny Craig in business.
author: Alex H.

description: So good!  A large was enough for lunch and dinner!  Had the Italian Combo on Dutch Crunch.  Great drink selection, too!
author: Sheri W.

description: Always a great Northbeach visit after a BLT from Freddies!
author: Gordon L.

description: Over the course of a 10 week internship, I think my partner (creative, not life) and I went to Freddie's close to 30 times. Is it really really good? No. But compared to its surroundings, it's incredible. Think I tried mostly everything without a problem, though the falafel's a bit underwhelming. It tends to get a bit crowded around lunch, but "Freddy" keeps his harem of workers running pretty smoothly. I'd go back if I was unfortunate enough to be in the area.
author: Aaron Z.

description:
A good, solid, no-silliness sandwich and a beverage joint. The folks behind the counter are a smart blend of friendly, brusque, and patient. 
They let me hem and haw and ask questions, they smiled when I settled on an order at long last, they worked fast, and all was tasty. They have meaty and veggie options, including a darn noshable falafel.

They do have some deli salad stuff, but I was all about my nicely cut & wrapped sammie (sarnie for the Brits) and dry ginger ale.

Thanks, Freddie's! You do honorable work.
author: triple b.

description:
I suppose this is an alright place if you just want a nothing special deli sandwich. I ordered a vegetarian on Dutch crunch. The sandwich was HUGE (I couldn't even eat half of it) and very reasonably priced. The bread was a little stale and the veggies were run of the mill (lettuce, tomato, onion, avocado, cheese, and pickles). I had to throw out the potato salad after one bite due to too much mayonnaise (which I despise, but I was so hungry when I put my order in, so I decided to gamble). 

This place isn't for me, but I can understand why my office mates are drawn to it, considering the limited selection of lunch places in the neighborhood.
author: Michelle L.

description: What can I say about Freddies? Best sandwiches hands down! .... Been coming here since I used to go to middle school right across the street! I still drive here just to reminisce about the old days. I love all their sandwiches and the people there are super nice and friendly. Great drinks selection, great fresh cuts of all kinds of meat. I will be coming to Freddies forever.
author: Frankie L.

description: My coworker dragged me around for almost 20 minutes to find this place. When we finally found out, I thought to myself what's so big about this place? While waiting my friend pointed out on the glass wall all the Yelps and awards this place received only to be disappointed in this place! I ordered a basic Club sandwich with avocado and I was totally ignored on my order. After 6 other customers received their orders the lady (possible owner) said it would be a few more minutes..hell I gave her 20 min and still nothing...to say the least I asked for a refund and while getting it the cashier than stated, "They're making your sandwich now." I said No thank and not my problem... oh well ....
author: Marco R.

description: This place is ok...but seriously???4 1/2 stars?  Y'all are trippin'  I have worked in this neighborhood for a few years and got many a sandwich here...don't get me wrong, they are totally editable....but for real.  Walk a few more blocks to cafe Capriccio - that is a freaking sandwich!  Only a few blocks and knocks the socks of Freddies - or go over to the park and get a sandwich at La Spiaggia - pay the extra 1-2 dollars and have a real culinary delight...Freddies is passable - but why bother when you can have near sandwich perfection at these other places?
author: Laurel H.

description: Loved it. Great Turkey sandwich on ciabatta roll.
author: chico t.

description:
AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Sandwiches taste soo good.
*Honey Roasted Turkey on soft sourdough
*Hot Pastrami on Rye
*Chicken Salad on Dutch
*Tuna salad is BOMB:)

They have an enormous variety of drinks, like lots and lots!  even beer!
Prices are very reasonable, great little gem in the heart of North Beach
If you dont eat here...you havent lived
author: littleone J.

description: Freddie's Sandwiches' are fantastic. The small is enough for one person and you can split large two ways.  I recommend  Italian combo, oh yeah, and stay away from those individually wrapped cookies on the counter.... totally not worth the calories.  They can get packed at lunch time, so plan ahead.
author: dan d.

description: There's an apparent reason this joint is always packed to the brim; where during lunch hours, you can see lines exceeding the front entrance, sometimes rounding the corner! Granted, the wait can be a pain the ass sometimes, but it's definitely worth it for a sandwich from Freddie's. Simply put, this deli is, by far, the best sandwich shop in the the city (this coming from a guy who absolutely loves his sammies and has been to most, if not all, of the delis spread throughout San Francisco). My usual order, as I'm sure is the case for most frequenters, is the Italian Combo; their signature sammie. They're incredibly generous with the meat cuts, and the breads used are very fresh and extremely flavorful. The jalapeño spread, in my humble opinion, is a must; adding that extra little dimension of flavor which causes an orgasmic explosion of taste within your mouth as you bite into it; fucking mind-blowing. Freddie's sandwiches make life seem absolutely trouble-free during those fifteen heavenly minutes in which you and your sandwich get completely lost in your own little euphoric world.
author: Bryan H.

description: I just had THE best sandwhich ever. My friend brought me out here today from the FiDi and I was pleasantly surprised. The bread was really fresh as was everything else. As we were sitting on the bench right outside, I couldn't stop gushing about how good my sandwich was! I love how it still has the old school charm. I thought the people working there were great too. I will definitely be back.
author: Deana D.

description:
This is my pick for the north beach.  My dad grew up in this neighborhood and would always take me here when I was a kid and they have been producing great sandwiches forever.  My dad remembers ordering his sandwich at the counter and only having to pay 15 cents for his sandwich.   Unfortunately the prices are not the same as thirty years ago but the sandwiches are still great.   

I usually order the italian combo on a soft roll.   this is a perfect sandwich to bring to a Giants day game.  The only issue is parking, but they do have a 15 minute parking spot in the front that you might get lucky with.   Or you can also easily call in your order and just run in and get your sandwich.
author: Bryan W.

description: Freddie's Deli is a sandwich I cross the city for.  Solid proportion of meat to toppings to bread.  Plenty of choices for size, bread, meat, toppings and special spreads.  Try the turkey with both the garlic and jalapeno spread.  I've been bringing that sandwich to Giants games for years and loving it.  Just remember to hold the tomatoes if you won't be eating it right away.  Nothing earth shattering, but if you are looking for one heck of a solid sandwich to fit your appetite (large or small), Freddie's is tough to beat.
author: Kalen L.

description: This is the place to go to grab a huge, tasty, and reasonably priced sandwich. I get the Italian? I think it's that. I get it with only the deli meats, no lettuce, tomato, pickles and with the mayo spread on the cheese side. Personal preference but it taste better that way. You could get a large one and share it with someone. It'll be enough, trust me.  It can get extremely crowded, especially during lunch hours but they try their best to get you in out and happy with your sammy.
author: Juliane N.

description: Solid Sando and good place.  Really enjoy their dutch crunch bread.  I will be back to Freddies.
author: Harry E.

description: Based on the glowing Yelp recommendations, I've been meaning to stop by and try out Freddie's for a long time. Finally, this morning I found myself in the neighborhood and it was almost lunch (err sandwich time). As you'd imagine, there was a long line around lunch time for this popular place. I had  a ham and salame sandwich on hard sourdough roll (gotta try the soft roll next time). The sandwich was expertly made -- its easily the best in this part of town (North Beach/Warf area).
author: Neil K.

description: We were hungry after our Alcratraz tour so I used the yelp app on my iphone, and up pops Freddie's.  We headed over and had some great sandwiches (yummy egg salad!).  There's a huge selection of drinks and chips too.  What pushed this place over to a 5 star experience was the steady stream of kids from the neighborhood coming in to buy snacks after school.  And when one little kid was a little short, the friendly guy behind the counter (Freddie?) let her get her snack anyway.  Reminds me of the old soda fountain I used to go to as a kid.  Minus the soda fountain, of course.
author: kate m.

description: ahhh... Freddie's sandwiches brings me back to the good old middle school days. I remember we had student discounts because Francisco middle school was just right across from this tiny sandwich shop so I believe any half sandwich we got only cost us $2.50. If you ever want to try this place I would highly recommend turkey on dutch bread. Omg so good! But go before noon because they run out of dutch bread really quick. They close at 4pm so grab yours while you can!
author: Tracy A.

description: Definitely not the greatest sandwich in the city. I probably wouldn't even go there if I was on that side of the city because I'd end up going to an Italian deli.  But if you are in the area a lot, head to this place. It gets crowded. The garlic spread was a bit much, but maybe that's your thing. Get a large and save a half.
author: Scott L.

description: We recently bought a condo across the street from Freddie's, and I'd be lying if I said the fact that it was across the street from Freddie's was not a factor in our decision.  Freddie's has great sandwiches and great service.  The Italian combo on a soft roll is deelish.  But get there early, the soft rolls always tend to sell out!
author: Erica G.

description:
this place has more of a nostalgic value to me, aside from having tasty tasty sandwiches! my dad used to take me there when i was a young lad. we'd get a few sandwiches and then we'd go to his softball game. i'd sit there and watch him play, with my coke and delicious freddie's sandwich in hand. 

mmm... i love sandwiches. especially, salami sandwiches. freddie's also makes their own special soft rolls. my dad loves the macaroni salad there. 

i think on a saturday afternoon, we can spend about $50 on sandwiches alone. did i say how much i love sandwiches? the poorboy there are pretty spiffy as well.

it's like a family tradition that my father has passed on to me. he's been going there since he was a kid, then took me there when i was young, so i guess it's only right that i take my son there someday to enjoy what i would define as a little slice of heaven... freddie's sandwiches.

now there is only one thing left, to find a wife.
author: Nathan J.

description: I've been going to Freddie's since I was in my mother's womb.  My Mom grew up in North Beach and she started going there when it was Ralph's in the 1930s.  Over the years we have loved the sandwiches and my nieces and nephews also grew up on these sandwiches.   We're old school & stick to the Italian Combo on the original bread
author: P S.

description: my *first* time at freddy's. and it was good. i liked that i was able to see what it looked like and the menu before i stepped in. some of the pressure was off during a rush lunch hour. line to the left- ordering, line to the right- waiting. step up, order. italian. small. dutch. everything on it. done. easy, the ladies behind the line, they were kicking butt. awesome job. probably 15 minutes for my sandwich, an overly large amount of candy and chips to choose from. i did wish he had a basket of fruit, but the sandwich was satisfying.  *cash only*
author: Abigail W.

description: Been going here since I was a 6th grader at Francisco! I use to stuff my fat ass throught he hole in the fence on Francisco... get my Italian combo and soda.. then stuff my fat ass back through to get back in. Oh the good times. The bread is fresh and the meat is great! Love this place. It might be time to take an afternoon break  and get to my fav lunch spot. Yummers
author: Bobby T.

description: Ordered their Club with provolone and Jalapeno spread on Dutch Crunch!  My stomach is smiling with enjoyment right now.  The service is friendly and you can get your sandwich in a decent amount of time depending on the line.  If there are five people ahead of you, expect a twenty minute wait.  If you're doing some mild liquor store shopping, you can also find what you need here.  There are a few tables outside, but not a lot of choices to sit if you decide to "dine-in."  Parking can be tough to come by.  Overall, great sandwich, I will definitely come back here again.
author: R B.

description:
so another intern story.. i'm such an idiot.  my mentor told me that this sandwich place was great and told me it was just one block down from our office.  i couldn't for the life of me find it.. maybe i was distracted by the middle schoolers at recess near by. anywho, i headed to the bk lounge..

so i asked him the following day where it was and he was in an uproar! "it's right there, you can't miss it!!!"  (prolly thinking, 'what a useless intern!')  i quickly hid my tail between my legs and hightailed it outta there.. haha..

anywho, i did find it across the street from the middle school. DUH.  the place had no seating except for this quaint little bench overlooking the little kiddies.. GOSH im starting to sound like a pedophile!  i'm not.. i'm just a 21-year old girl reminscing the fun times with my 8th grade homegirls. sigh..

i got a small hot pastrami on sweet dutch for $5.50 and a small 1/2 pint of potato salad for $2.20.  Oh and I grabbed an Orangina for $1.75.  Oran-gy-na rhymes with ja-nigh-na (my nameizzle)! 

the sandwich was very very good.  i got super excited because i thought they put alfalfa sprouts in my sandwich (i recently discovered it's Yum in sandwiches) but sadly it was just shredded iceberg lettuce.  the heated meat portions were just right and the bread was toasted to perfection!  the sandwich was not small at all!  i think its a mind-trick tho.  they slice in it half and wrap it individually to make it look bigger!

I couldn't care much about the potato salad.  it was too mustardy and didn't have the right zing to it.  prolly from a mix or something.  why didn't i just grab the kettle chips? WHY!?!?

Since its near the proximity of my internship, i will perhaps come here one last time.  unless of course i get tossed on my ass at my work, kicked to the curb.. maybe i'm just self-deprecating right now.. you think?
author: Janina U.

description: Great old-school sandwich joint. One of the better lunch options in the godforsaken area near where I work. I really liked the onion bread the one time I ordered it, and Freddie's offers lots of bread types in general. Props for offering real, fresh, non-preserved meat (although you can get that, too). And for taking orders over the phone for pickup. I may have to schlep here from blocks away, but at least I don't have to wait too long once I've arrived.
author: Tara M.

description: Freddie's is fantastic. They have delicious breads, especially the soft sourdough, meat, especially the black forest ham, and fixins. The jalapeno spread is great on a tuna sandwich. The "small" sandwich is 6'' and loaded. It's the best deal in the neighborhood and tourist-free. They are fast, helpful and you can call in your order ahead of time.
author: Jessi H.

description: The turkey melts in your mouth...just like mm's. Very good sandwich shop. You know it's a go when the sign outside says it's been in business since the 1920s
author: Sammy S.

description:
One of my fav spots for a sando... not easy to find a good deli in SF.
This place is awesome. Gets a bit busy during lunch hour but if you call it in you can bypass the line...
author: Doug A.

description: Very good, and reasonably priced.  (Whereas the prices at my corner market keep creeping up every year, Freddie's seems like it remains constant.)  I used to go here at least 3 times a week when I worked in the 55 Francisco bldg (across from Houston's.)  Now I make the trek across town quarterly.  At first I thought it was because it was a decent sandwich that fit with my low-paid, non-dot com PR salary.  Then I realised it's because it's a damn fine sandwich.  And they have this pepperoncini spread (just minced peppers)... so you get some in every bite.  The Italian combo is great as is the chicken salad.  Huge selection of drinks and chips, too.
author: darla s.

description: I remember I was in 4th grade eating outside on the bench during lunchtime when I looked at the kid sitting next to me opening up the white parchment paper i was so familiar with and unwrapped his sandwich. To my surprise and excitement I said, "Hey! That's a Freddie's sandwich! How do you know about that place?" I was kinda bummed that he knew about our secret sandwich spot that my dad used to take my brother and i to all the time which would be a special treat since it wasn't close to home. My dad grew up eating from this place too and still loves it. i haven't been back as often as I'd like, but the sandwiches are still the same as they were 15 years ago...even 30 years ago (so i've heard. i'm not old enough to confirm that one!). Love the bread, love the meat, love Freddy's.
author: Jen Y.

description:
is this the fourth owner...i am not sure...i knew the one owner before this guy when the prices were right and a sandwich meant just fresh bread and sliced meats.
now an ok sandwich shop if you are in the neighborhood and needing a sandwich with chips and a snapple.
author: Cee G.

description: I've grown up with this place in my heart and it will remain there forever. The Italian combo sandwich is the only way to go and make sure you get it on dutch crunch bread. The meats, cheese, and condiments meld together perfectly into the quintessential deli prize. I am sad to report that I'm not in San Francisco more often to enjoy what Freddie's has to offer!
author: Christina N.

description: Freddie's was a Friday tradition at the old office location.  Although I have tried most of the sandwiches on the board, far and away my favorite is the chicken salad, everything, on dutch crunch, no cheese.  Simply amazing.  I think the way the owner is makes it unique.  Far better then the angry, yelling RJ's lady over by Levi's plaza.  The chips and sodas are over priced as should be expected, but the sandwich prices are reasonable.  You will get full off of the smalls, and getting a large will yield leftovers.  I am thinking about making the trek out there soon just because it has earned a place in my heart.
author: Daniel M.

description: Not a bad sandwich, but, bad attitude. Owner, try to smile. Try to cheer up. I'm not picking your pocket, I'm spending my hard-earned cash in your place. I might have actually considered going back and trying another small sandwich for $5.75, because the Italian Combo I ate wasn't too bad, except for the fact that Palermos isn't too far away and has better sandwiches ......  and attitude.
author: Rich M.

description:
Finally went to Freddie's after working in the area for 4 months and hearing my co-workers rave about it.  I am a HUGE sandwich fan (if I could eat sandwiches for every meal, believe me, I would) so I was excited to try the place out.  I got the Italian combo on Dutch Crunch bread and unfortunately the bread was a little dry but the insides made it sooo worth it!

Great prices and friendly, fast service.
author: Lisa D.

description:
Congrats, Katelin H.   I'm on Yelp right now because Eddy *did* print out your review and put it in the window with the others.  That took courage, and confidence in his product.   

And he can afford to be confident too!  The sandwiches here are delicious and  *large,* enough for two lunches, making them frugal, especially for North Beach/the Marina.   Service is quick given the fact that at lunch they seem to serve about a million people.   I can get in and get out and eat before my half hour lunch hour is spent.

And guess what? Eddy always recognizes me and remembers my order, even though I only drop in once a week at most.  Maybe it has something to do with the fact that  I tip every time I come in and kinda stand out from the crowd a bit for that reason.  I'm also polite and respectful, like I am whenever I have to deal with folks in the restaurant industry, it's a tough job!   Finally, I make a point to come in just prior to the lunch rush, so I'm not demanding attention or special treatment when the place is jumpin, and that probably makes me stand out too.

But even if it weren't so, the sandwiches they provide are top caliber, and that's what I go for.  Consistently good sandwiches at a reasonable price, in a neighborhood that's tough to find good food on a working Joe's salary.  If I wanted someone to pretend to be my pal, I'd go to a bar.
author: steffan z.

description: Solid sandwich and a fair price.  No parking and nowhere to sit - so grab and go.  Coit Tower is not too far if you want to take in some bay views while enjoying lunch.
author: Moe J.

description: I love getting their mortadella sandwiches. Reminds me of being back in Italy. Just an FYI - call ahead otherwise the line goes out the door during lunch!!!
author: Natalie S.

description: Wow! My new Friday lunch spot. Thanks Yelpers. The Italian Combo on soft sourdough is kickin! Good service and decent prices. Can't wait to try all their other sandwiches.
author: Leroid D.

description: Awesome sandwiches!  Closes early though so not much of a dinner option.  Come early or on weekends.
author: Rob K.

description: Filling sandwiches and good prices. Love their salami and like their Italian sandwiches. Make sure to ask for a spread too.
author: Lester L.

description: An outstanding sandwich shop for the past 25+ years I've been a customer.  I think it should almost be an institution in San Francisco, it's so good.  The freshness and simplicity of the sandwich are the key factors.   The soft sourdough bread hasn't been replicated elsewhere to my knowledge.  The perfectly cut meats are delectable.  The minimal construction of bread, mustard/mayo and meat lets one enjoy every facet of the sandwich.  The uncomplicated meal also lends itself well to saving as leftovers or re-heating.   What more can one ask for in a family-run eatery?
author: Michael W.

description: To save 20 minutes during the lunch hour, call in ahead and order your sandwich to pick up.
author: David L.

description: Molinari's who? Seriously, $5 for a small sandwich (which is actually not small at all) is easily the best lunch deal in the area. The sweet dutch roll is perfect and doesn't cut the roof of you mouth like virtually every piece of stale bread at Molinari's. Sure they have good meat, but they need to walk over to Freddie's to see what a real sandwich is...
author: Nicolas H.

description: I live around the corner from Freddie's and decided to try it today. The sandwiches are delicious and reasonably priced. I had the Prosciutto sandwich with everything on it. I rarely do that (put everything on it), but I had to see how good their sandwiches were. They are fast, friendly and I will be going there anytime I want a great sandwich!
author: K. F.

description: Great little sandwich place right in my old hood.  Everything here is very fresh.  My son loves their chicken salad sandwich.  I'm a ham sandwich kinda girl.  You can't go wrong here.
author: Stella C.

description:
Freddie's is still a great place for sandwiches but it is not the GREAT place it was back in the 60's when the sandwiches were really enormous with meat pile so high that it was almost impossible to eat! Boy, do I ever miss those days...

Sandwiches are now about half as large and not quite as tasty as in those days but still very good. I don't frequent as often as I used to because it's gotten pricier than I like for what I get.
author: John C.

description: Yes, five stars. I come here twice a week for lunch. Excellent fare, great service, ATM, salt and vinegar chips, Gatorade or Snapple or vitamin water, fresh deli cuts and cheese on an onion roll, and a nice view of the water as you walk down one block and come within earshot of the loudest sea-lions on pier 39. I love San Francisco.
author: Michael L.

description:
Ok, their sandwiches are pretty damn good.  I really can't say it's the best I've had because I usually like my sandwiches toasty and hot.  This place brings back memories.  Growing up in North Beach, I went to Francisco Middle School, which is literally right next to this place.  I remember coming here for a sandwich when we werent' suppose to leave campus, but I couldn't resist getting one of their sandwiches for lunch!

And of course while I was preggers, I craved for a good sandwich and I actually walked (more like waddled) all the way there from fidi to get one.  After many years, their sandwiches are still very good.
author: Katniss B.

description: they have a really good variety. plenty of spreads to choose from. fresh bread. friendly service, i have nothing bad to say! ill be back!
author: Lisa N.

description: My favorite sandwich shop in the city - I get one every weekend.  Their sandwiches are great on the soft sourdough toasted, and the owners are  very friendly :)
author: Dave C.

description:
For the past 8 years, I've been eating crap sandwiches from the Safeway deli, meanwhile just a block from my house, hidden on a corner you'd never stumble across, lies Freddies sandwiches.  
WHAT!?!?? are you kidding me? i've been eating processed, half-assed Safeway sammies while this semi-angry Sammy dude has been kicking out stellar, fresh sammies just 45 seconds from my front door?  huh?  Well, after 8 years of those crummy sammies, today I did find Freddies, and I'll never eat another janky Safeway sammie again.  
The bread selection is fresh and good.  The meats and cheese, also high-quality and fresh tasting.  They have a great selection of drinks as Kettle chips..not to mention a delicious italian cole slaw that could stand alone as a high end salad!   
What else could I ask for except to rewind 8 years of my life, and do it all over again.. with my Freddies.
author: G. H.

description: this is my favorite sandwich store because they are fast, their sandwiches are tasty, and they give you big portions. Oh yeah, the prices are very good for the amount they give you.
author: Q W.

description: Freddie's is a good sandwich place if you are looking for a reasonable-priced sandwich on decent bread and like pesto. My biggest complaint about the place is the wait. Last time I went in, I had to wait 20 minutes for my sandwich, and another customer who came in 15 minutes after me got her sandwich before me. I use to frequent it more but 20 minutes is often 15 minutes too long....
author: Hoppie B.

description: Absolutely four stars - When I'm away from SF it's Freddie's that I daydream about. (Yes I'm a Francisco Jr High alum - 1972 to 1974 - so there's about five hundred sandwiches right there. And they are just as good today.
author: Brian C.

description: Waking up last thng I usually want to do is cook and the first thing I usually want to do is eat. So on the days that I feel like eating it's great to know that Freddies is a short 3 blocks away. I usually go for the large Italian Combo on Rye with no mayo, avacado, toasted and with provolone. I generally save the second half for later. My advice is to call in before you leave because it usually takes about ten minutes. I believe they toast the bread on a panini press. Eat the first half on bench outside with a beer and save the second half for later.
author: Steve Q.

description:
Hands down one of the best sandwich shops in all of SF. I got the vegetarian with the oil and vinegar but next time I'm going to go for one of the monstrous mortadella ... either way, don't forget to ask for the jalapeno or garlic spread.
I don't get the nits about it being a deli w/o tables to eat in ... why the hell would you want to eat-in? Just take it down to the water and enjoy your damn lunch!
And what's this about the owner not being friendly? Eddie (owner of Freddie's) is as nice a guy as you can meet. Besides, he's too damn busy serving up sandwiches otherwise you'll knock him for being too slow. If you want the warm fuzzies, go call your mother!
author: Hopping J.

description: By far the best subs in the Fisherman's Wharf/North Beach area.  I live down the street and eat here for lunch whenever I have a chance.  Only negative I have (and this does not reduce my rating) is that he isn't open on Sundays.  Freddie's - hire extra staff to run the place on Sunday so I can satisfy my craving!
author: Tony C.

description:
argh, this is a 3.5 star review. i'm really torn. give me a few more weeks eating lunch in this part of town and i'll probably bump it up.

this is nominally an italian deli, although there's also corned beef and falafel. bread selection is outstanding. portions are ginormous for the prices. quality of meats and ingredients is just okay. 

this is a fast, professional, deli. no surprises. pretty awesome drink selection too.

last time i was in, someone ordered an egg-salad sandwich with bacon. what a fantastic concept. now i need to go back tomorrow and get an egg-salad sandwich with bacon. amazing. the more you know.
author: Wangston P.

description: Freddie's is a San Francisco landmark, providing excellent service and quality sandwiches. I find this little corner deli the perfect place to pick up a great sandwich during my lunch break or to pick up a quick repas to take to an outing. I especially love being able to place my order beforehand over the phone and having it ready within five minutes.
author: Guillaume J.

description: I love this place. Totally not pretentious. Just a good, old fashioned neighborhood sandwich shop and it doesn't pretend to be anything else but that. No skimping on the meats and a nice selection of breads.  The Italian combo is the best deal and one small will feed two easily. At first I was a little wary about ordering the garlic spread, but then I found out it was mixed with parsley which helps to counteract the "garlic breath". It adds that little special something, that other sandwich places would probably charge $2 for. The jalapeño spread is good, too, when you're in that spicy mood. It is sometimes a bit of a wait, but the trick is to just call your order in. Enjoy.
author: Lucie F.

description: Huge sandwhiches at good prices.  I god a 6 inch sandwhich that I couldn't finish in one sitting (and I'm usually still hungry after eating footlongs at subway).
author: Brian S.

description: FABULOUS sandwich shop tucked away behind all the pomp and tourism that is Fisherman's Wharf... they've got great vegetarian sandwiches and amazing meat-y options that will make you remember why you liked bread so much in the first place... Don't go in the 3-4 hour though because the place fills up with junior high kids looking for a sugar fix (unless of course you like that sort of thing :)
author: Anjali K.

description: One of the BEST Sandwich shops in SF!! We love Ed (the owner) and the ladies behind the counter. They always make the most delicious sandwiches. Our favs are the Tuna, Italian Combo and just a simple cheese sandwich TOASTED!!! They have the best chip selection as well. I have been going to Freddie's for years now! I just wish it were open on Sunday...sigh...
author: CC C.
